name: Rental unit in Ottawa · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.96 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Westboro Village is a century-old community, and was once the heart of Nepean Township. The old stone town hall still proudly stands on Richmond Road, the original route westward from Bytown. Three blocks to the west is Maplelawn manor, Ottawa's second oldest building (built in 1831) and a National Historic site, which now houses a Keg steak restaurant and features a vintage walled garden open to the public.
host_about:
My adventurous spirit was awakened when I went on a three-month backpacking trip around Europe after I graduated from university. Each and every year since, I've made a point of travelling somewhere different and interesting. I later discovered my passion for bicycle touring and most of my journeys from 1994 on have been on two wheels. I enjoy meeting new people, and for me, welcoming guests to my home often feels like travelling without leaving the house.

I am an industrial designer by training, but I have specialized in exhibit and environmental graphic design. Most of my work is with the national museums in Ottawa and with the National Capital Commission. I have lived in Ottawa for over three decades and have acquired a fondness for Ottawa's history and culture and try my best to pass on its stories and traditions.

Living in an area that is a confluence of rivers and waterways, I am also an avid paddler. I enjoy taking people on a canoe or kayak out on the Ottawa River to experience its special spirit, or on the Rideau Canal for its rich heritage.

name: Home in North Gower · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Most folks ask about Strathmere - we are less than 1 km away!
host_about: Working professional (KPMG). Living with a 4 year-old. Living the country life in rural Ottawa, but like to travel as much as we can afford.

host_about: I am Elena. I am a peaceful person living in a beautiful Ottawa condo with a river view. I share my space with my guests and often travel using Airbnb myself. My hobbies are poodles, yoga, tango, cooking and cultural events. I am always ready to share my knowledge about culture in Ottawa. I hope you will enjoy your stay in my happy space with me and my little poodle Joy.

name: Home in Ottawa · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: The worlds longest skating rink, a UNESCO heritage site, the Rideau Canal, is only a 5  minute walk. The General Hospital and CHEO on Smyth, are a 5 minute drive. Our neighborhood is very pedestrian and green. The nearby Brentwood park features open air tennis courts.
host_about: We love to slow travel throughout the world without a strict itinerary, taking time to discover and immerse ourselves in the rich cultures, customs, languages and architecture of the countries we visit. We are always humbled by what we learn.

name: Home in Ottawa · ★4.61 · 5 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Backstreet, small family oriented, peaceful, clean and quiet
host_about:
We have been living in Ottawa for years. I am a statistician for Federal government and my wife works for City of Ottawa. We love traveling and do our trips whenever there is a chance. We used lots of Airbnb and B&B. We know what travelers need and would like to serve them the best as they are "us".

Please introduce yourself and your group as we need to know our guests as you do.
You are welcome to our house!

name: Home in Ottawa · ★4.86 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: This is one of the trediest, most walkable neighbourhoods in Ottawa. Close to shops, restaurants, bike and walking paths, beaches, live theatre, art galleries...it is a great location to enjoy Ottawa from.
host_about:
Hi! I'm Greg, Calgary born and happily transplanted to Ottawa. Educated and employed as an Economist,  I am also a trained Heritage Carpenter.  Owning and maintaining real estate is a passion of mine.  Giving back to the community is important to me and our business is a "Champion of Hope" financial donor for a local men's shelter in Ottawa, Ontario. 

Hi! I'm Valerie, and have been living in Ottawa for most of my life. My professional background is international development with a focus on finance and project management. I have toured the world - 200 cities in 61 countries - and I love to explore, travel, eat, cook and read.  My very first trip was to Haiti and my latest expedition was a fabulous  South African safari.  I am also a Personal Travel Designer and I love both five star journeys and budget backpacking.  My favourite poem is Invictus,  and I would describe myself as lucky, blessed, happy, a foodie, an early adopter, endlessly curious,  the wife of Greg and the mother of two fabulous daughters - who are global citizens.  

We feel very fortunate to be able to host so many wonderful guests in Ottawa. 

Cheers and hope to see you soon! 
Greg and Valerie
host_neighbourhood: Braemar Park - Bel Air Heights - Copeland Park

name: Townhouse in Ottawa · ★4.73 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths
neighborhood_overview:
My house is located in a family working neighbourhood. At times you will see children outside playing.

The neighbourhood is mostly quiet. It is located close to Tim Horton’s, the community swimming pool, tennis courts and a nice park. It is also located close to the shopping malls.
host_about:
Tall Black female who is a single mother of one girl.  I work during the days.  I have hosted international students for the past 9 years.  I fully understand how to share my space and how to make others feel comfortable and at home in my shared space.

I like to go shopping, to travel and to watch movies and to read.  I love travelling to the Caribbean and to Florida and other parts of the USA.  I love comedy shows, I  love music and dancing.  I also love to try a variety of foods.

I love to travel by land, air and rail.  I like staying at hotels and meeting interesting people.

My life motto is to live and let's live.

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.57 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
host_about: I am a dynamic person and I like to have fun and meet new people around the world.

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.71 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
host_about:
Welcome to the National Capital of Canada, our beautiful Ottawa!!!

Our favourite hobbies now are gardening in summer and skiing when there is snow. 
We love to entertain in all seasons and to attend theater evenings, concerts and restaurants -that is why our condos are so well located!!! So close to all Ottawa major attractions, from Parliament Hill to Dows Lake and our home is in the country side -sort of- in a 3 acres property in the West end, 30 minutes drive,  looking over a valley, with lots of gardens, some natural and wild too, and partial on the Alvar ecosystem - a natural formation very dry and rocky.

When we travel, we also prefer location, location, location. Second  only by spotless clean accomodations. A good bed, good shower, pillows and best food. We travelled extensively by now to nearly all continents - by train, car, air or sea. 

Maria, a Journalist who became an Interior Designer is originally from Brazil living in Canada from more than 20 years. She loves cooking, reading and movies, when is not traveling, mostly to Europe or South America. "My background includes Law, Communications and Romanic Languages, I still practice Interior Design on part time, a passion of mine".

Jim is a retired professional from high tech who loves nature and family life. "Originally from Nova Scotia, lived most of my mature life in the National Capital Region of Canada". 

AirBnB is a new experience for us, who love trying new paths, and we look forward to welcoming you!!! 
To those that can stay in our home in a sort of rural environment, near Kanata, in the West of Hwy 417, we are proud of sharing our gardens, when the season allows. One should at least try!!!

name: Condo in Ottawa · ★4.70 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: There are several restaurants around the block, a car rental and basic needs in the new ShoppersDrugMart -from milk to Magazines, sandwiches, juices -and the LCBO both by the corner of Bank St. at Gladstone. Staples is few steps away.

name: Home in Ottawa · ★4.76 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: A quiet tree lined area only a few minute walk to a local lake for swimming, the river pathway for running/biking or walking...beautiful sunsets and views of Quebec across the river. We are located steps from the number 7 bus route and in walking distance of a corner store and restaurants and coffee shops.
host_about: I am a photographer based in Canada's national capital. While we love to bike, ski and cottage close to home, our wanderlust and sense of adventure have us exploring whenever opportunity allows. We have benefited from being welcomed in many AirBnB homes and are happy to extend this to you as well.

name: Home in Ottawa · ★4.91 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: Beautiful Heritage Street.
host_about:
Phil and I enjoy entertaining, cooking , music , travel and all  of the great things this life has to offer. We thought that by being hosts on Airbnb , we could share our love for the city of Ottawa and our well loved home.

I am working on the challenges of pay equity and diversity in the workplace. Phil also changed careers and is now on the front lines in health care. 


Welcome. We will make your stay a happy one !

name: Home in Ottawa · ★4.95 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
host_about: We've been traveling with Airbnb since 2012, and hosting since 2013.

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.72 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are in the West, only 15 minutes drive from the high tech hub of Kanata (by March Road or Hwy 417) between the lovely towns of Carp and Almonte, in this estate community of Corkery, approximately 35 minutes from downtown Ottawa, as there are 0 traffic lights between our house and the Hwy exits downtown.

Perfect for those driving from Toronto who want to avoid the rush hours, because we are located 15 minutes West from the exit of Hwy 416 and few minutes from Hwy 7. And yes, you need a car here.
In Kanata there are all sort of restaurants, bars, pubs, shopping, the Canadian Tire Centre, the Wave Pool, Bayshore Shopping Mall, Kanata Centrum and more. Some great places to eat few minutes from home as in the famous "The Swan at Carp" and its real canadian seasonal menu, from regular fare to bison and locally made chocolates...wow!

Nearby there are several Golf Courses, two ski hills, a local airport, Carp Market, Mississippi River, an Elk farm, river beaches

name: Home in Ottawa · ★4.64 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: Convenient to public transit and parks. Shopping and restaurants nearby. Free parking on location.
host_about: Janice is a semi retired arts and culture educator and Garry has a background in Emergency Management and Municipal Government. The historic Gothic stone church is a family homestead that has been lovingly restored over many years. They enjoy travelling with their children around the world and showing them as much about the world as possible, connecting them to its people, nature, architecture, culture, food and art.  They believe each day holds adventures and lessons. They appreciate and value sharing their home, their knowledge and their time to help enrich the lives of those they meet. They love the outdoors, sports, music, films, and cooking together.  They are experienced hosts and have a long history with acting as host family to those new to the country and to their community. They enjoy promoting local culture, businesses, the arts and sharing tips about their Town with others so they can feel like a 'Local'.  Sharing brings people around the world closer and they appreciate the friendships they make from their travels as well as from those they've had the privilege of hosting.

name: Home in Ottawa · 5 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2.5 baths
host_about: We live in Canada. I have a beautiful thirteen-year-old daughter and a six year-old boy. I love to go for walks and I practice yoga. We are a happy little family.

name: Townhouse in Ottawa · ★4.85 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Walking distance to Civic Hospital, Parkdale Market and Wellington Village. 3 min walk to shops, restaurants, outdoor market, bus stops & 10min walk to Ottawa River Parkway. 9km from downtown (15min direct bus ride or 7 min drive). Quiet area with lots to do. Friendly neighbours and a short walk to coffee shops, Parkdale market and the Parkway to stroll along the water or watch the sunset or take a bike ride along the paths. Grocery store, liquor store, beer store in the area. 2min walk to several different bus stops. Easy Queensway (hwy 417) access, 1min by car.

Hintonburg/Wellington West area is a trendy and safe place with lots of great restaurants and shopping. The nearly three-kilometre stretch along Wellington Street West – from Ottawa’s LRT line (called the O-Train) to Island Park Drive (an elegant stretch of homes) – is about 10 minutes west of Parliament Hill.

Its eastern border is the O-Train Trillium Line, just west of Preston Street, with Centretown W
host_about:
I love to travel and really enjoy meeting new people and learning about different cultures. I am morally aligned with the AIRBNB vision of helping you discover amazing places while you travel within the comforts of home.

I have been an Airbnb host now for over five years. I love interacting with my guests and ensuring they're happy in their space. 

I'm non-smoking, responsible, clean and very respectful of other peoples property.

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.65 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: I love that I can walk to the Coliseum Movie Theatre to enjoy the latest show.  It's also a quick walk to Britannia Beach for a relaxing stroll along the water or to a Conservation Area, Mud Lake ... beautiful creatures in the forest where the city disappears.  There is a fantastic natural health food store down the street called Rainbow Foods, located next to Farm Boy and across the street from Shoppers Drugmart
host_about:
I'm an actor and acting instructor who loves doing both jobs both at home and other parts of the world.  Traveling is number one on my list of things to do.  Traveling and teaching or acting, even better.  Meeting people from other places and cultures makes my life even more colorful.  So grateful for the ones I've met so far, whether they've stayed in my place or I at theirs.

I'm looking forward to many more adventures.

All the very best,
Claudia :)

neighborhood_overview:
One of Ottawa's trendiest neighbourhoods, Hintonburg and Wellington West were singled out by Ottawa Magazine as "one of Ottawa's 20 best neighbourhoods":
While some people mourn the loss of the bingo parlours and pawnshops that once studded Wellington Street, others have welcomed with open arms the arrival of chic restaurants and quirky shops. From the high-end fare at Back Lane Café to the luxury yarns at Wabi Sabi, Hintonburg is definitely moving on up."

Less than 10 minute drive to Costco, Lone Star, East Side Marios and several other neat places.

name: Bungalow in Ottawa · ★4.80 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Westboro has some of the best restaurants in the city! You could dine out every night during your stay or cook at home. Richmond Road has many outdoor shops, cafes, boutiques , gift shops, food retailers etc. During the summer go for a swim in the evening right behind my home at Kitschissippi beach! The bike path along the parkway offers safe biking to downtown within 30 minutes.
host_about: I've decided to open my home in Ottawa to fellow travellers! I'm new to Airbnb and open to suggestions. I've traveled on my own to India, Europe, USA, sailed in the Grenadine Islands, South America. I love Ottawa and have lived here most of my life. I own a business in the city and would gladly help you find the right place to shop, eat, visit etc.

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.87 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
If you are looking for privacy and the feeling of a secluded hideaway yet want to be close to all the amenities, you have found your haven! The Mer Bleue Apartment offers a country setting with a lot of land (1.5 acres) yet is only a short bicycle ride away from the heart of Orleans.

The house is located near the Mer Bleue bog, a 3,500-hectare NCC conservation area that has a northern eco-system more typical of the Arctic.
(website hidden)

There is also a large NCC trail network a short walk away that is perfect for walking, jogging, running, skiing, bicycling with beautiful nature scenery and wildlife.
host_about: Welcome to my profile!  I am an easygoing, fun loving professional that enjoys socializing as well as her quiet time.  My career is in IT.   I love real estate and have many renovation projects on the go so I am quite busy.  I love to travel and to talk to others about their travels and hobbies.  I am passionate about Cuba and I feel it is my second home.  I always want the best experience and accommodation for my guests and I pay great attention to details and quality so that you can relax and enjoy your stay.  I look forward to meeting you but if our schedules don't match then I wish you the best of stay and hope you feel at home here at the Mer Bleue Apartment.  All the best in your travels!!

host_about: Active person who is excited by travel and anything outdoors.

name: Home in Ottawa · ★4.96 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Quaint, tree lined neighborhood steps away from unique restaurants, and shopping as well as immediate access to transit, the Ottawa River Parkway and Gatineau Park. Minutes away from fantastic neighborhoods including Westboro, Hintonburg, Kanata (Kanata Tech Centre and the Department of National Defense DND Campus), Nepean, Barrhaven (RCMP headquarters), Gatineau and Downtown Ottawa via the Ottawa River Parkway.

We are surrounded by ample green space, which includes fabulous hiking and cycling trails. As well, we are only minutes away from the Ottawa River Parkway which runs directly to center of the city winding its way alongside the Ottawa River. A perfect place to walk, run, jog or cycle.
host_about:
We’ve made every effort to make your stay in Ottawa a relaxing and enjoyable experience. Take comfort in the many years of positive reviews we’ve received as super hosts. 

Please don't hesitate to reach out. We’re happy to respond quickly to any questions you may have before booking.

name: Condo in Ottawa · ★4.75 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Steps away from the trendy shops and restaurants of the ByWard Market.
Walking distance to Parliament Hill, Rideau Canal, Rideau Shopping Center, The US Embassy, The National Gallery, NAC, DND, Ottawa University.
24/7 Metro Grocery Store & LCBO across the street.
Parking lot across the street $8; on street at night, free 7 pm - 7 am;
host_about:
After I traveled the world and called 'home' 8 countries on 4 continents, Ottawa chose me and I settled here... for now... The sharing economy fascinates me and I look forward to welcoming people from around the world. 

My friends would describe me as easy going, fun and reliable. I am a straightforward, open minded person with a full life outside of work. 

This winter, I would like to go skiing more often and you are welcome to join me if you have time. I also enjoy espresso, red wine, bachata, canoe camping, gardening, cooking, road trips and stimulating conversations.

name: Condo in Ottawa · ★4.94 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The location is great with shops, cafes, restaurants, museum, parliament etc. all within walking distance. The unit is on the 2nd floor next to a stairwell for easy street access at a side door exit and also has an elevator for your added convenience.

Convenient access to public transportation or taxi service otherwise most places are within walking distance

Whether you are in town for a month or more this place can be just what you are looking for.
host_about:
Adopted Ottawa as home in 2001 (previously Toronto native) and absolutely love this beautiful city.  I enjoy most sports generally but tennis takes precedence since my move to Ottawa.

In my private and professional life I travel extensively and through it developed a keen sense of what a guest prizes vs what puts us off.  Also listening to my own guests has been key to the continued success as some of them have provided excellent feedback on ways to improve which led to evolving my space to keep it fresh and maintain excellent value.  My main goal is to earn high marks on each of the metrics of the review system at AirBNB along with guest comments which in my view is the real value proposition of my offering.

I speak fluent Portuguese, some Spanish and Greek.

Thanks for checking my listing out :-)

name: Guest suite in Ottawa · ★4.87 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is full of great folks and guests will enjoy meeting them. We live in a great central location for those who wish to take advantage of the Rideau Canal and easy access to great restaurants in various wonderful neighborhoods of Ottawa. We're a 5-minute walk to a local pub and a vegetarian restaurant and St. Paul's University. It is a 20-minute walk (or 5 minute drive) to Elgin Street restaurants and pubs, Loblaw's grocery, and liquor store.
host_about: We are a family of 4 who like to take advantage of the great things Ottawa has to offer - cycling on the extensive trails, running along the Rideau Canal, skating in the winter, hiking in the Gatineau Parc, and eating delicious food!

name: Home in Ottawa · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview: Westboro is one of Ottawa's liveliest neighbourhoods. The house is located 3 blocks from Richmond Road, Westboro's main street, which boasts 5 star restaurants, boutique coffee shops, designer shopping, yoga studios and more. Westboro beach is just a 20 minute walk. Hang out at the Westboro Beach Tiki bar and watch the sun set over the water while enjoying cocktails and live music.

name: Home in Ottawa · ★4.80 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.94 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Westboro is a vibrant, family friendly community. Richmond Road is lined with many boutiques and better known stores, cafés, yoga studios, and restaurants. Be sure to check out the market Saturday mornings.

For those with children, there are several neighbourhood parks with fun structures, kiddie pool/splash pad within a few blocks. There are extensive trails along the Ottawa River and nearby Westboro Beach about a 10 minute walk away.

Also close by (walking distance):

- The Works is a beloved Ottawa hamburger chain. It's known for its many topping selections (including peanut butter and macaroni - but not together). It has a neat atmosphere.
-Trio, with a boho atmosphere and delectable small plates.

host_about: We're from Ottawa, Ontario, Canada. Michael works for the government in Canada's northern communities. As all good Canadian boys do, he loves hockey. His love of hockey almost rivals his love of live music, dancing, relaxing at the cottage and cooking. Alisha is a high school English teacher. She loves working with youth, finds they keep her honest, and enjoys their exuberance. Michael's great cooking and tolerance of Alisha's ever-growing-library make up for the many hours he spends drafting for his fantasy league in the summer and glued to the screen in the fall-winter-spring. Together, they love to travel and hope to do more of it in the future.

name: Home in Ottawa · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: This is one of the most prized neighbourhoods in Ottawa: friendly, easy going, with lots of amenities close by - Brewer Park with its great kids playgrounds, dog park, naturalised marshlands, splash pad, and in the winter hockey rinks and speed skating oval.   Brewer's newly renovated local pool - it's all jjust down the street. Carleton University is 1 km away and has an olympic pool and all a University has to offer. Downtown is a short 15 mn bus ride ( with the stop just 2 block from our house: close enough to be convenient, not so close as to be noisy), or better yet a 25 minute bike ride along UNESCO heritage designated Rideau Canal.   I regularly run to Parliament along the running and biking trails, the kids love to canoe there or on the Rideau River 1 block away from our house.  Lots of parks and greenery , the Arboreteum allows a nice evening walk, and still we live close enough to  a grocery or convenience store that in the middle of cooking dinner, I can ask my daughter to d
host_about:
I am the father of 2 great little girls, the husband of the woman I've loved for over 24 years, an engineer,  glider pilot, love to fly, cycle and travel.  We prefer to travel by staying in people's home: it gives a better sense of place than an anonymous hotel would.  When we host at our house, we trust that people will treat our home well: leave it as you found it and take care of it as you'd like your home to be taken care of. 

We've travelled all over the world, and have found Ottawa is a great place to live: it's close to nature, there is lots to do in town with national museums, galleries, theaters, restaurants, and it's close to other cities and the USA. And we can live there in one of the best neighbourhoods, close to everything and yet, quiet and safe. 
Still, we like to get away and go to other countries - airbnb is a way for us to do that!

name: Townhouse in Ottawa · ★4.70 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
If you’re looking to live in the heart of downtown Ottawa, Centretown is the place to be. Centretown is a leafy residential district with a busy commercial core of clothes stores, brunch spots and lively Irish pubs on Elgin and Bank streets. The Rideau Canal is popular for its waterside trail and becomes an ice-skating rink in winter, while Dundonald and Jack Purcell parks are dotted with monuments and public artwork. The Canadian Museum of Nature has exhibits on Arctic fossils and polar bears.

Centretown’s history is naturally intertwined with the history of Ottawa, and you can see that history anywhere you look. Just north of the “official” boundaries of Centretown are the Parliament Buildings of Canada, the famous Chateau Laurier, the former Ottawa central train station, and historic Sparks St. West of Elgin, you’ll find many of the bank and financial towers that keep the city’s economy moving forward.

As you head further south, the character gradually changes

The World Heritage Site canal, with its bike/jogging/walking paths and green spaces, surrounds the neighbourhood on three sides. The house is a few minutes walk from the Canal.
The neighbourhood has a lively mix of residents including university students, seniors, families, and professional singles. People come from all over the city on the weekends to enjoy the pedestrian environment on Bank St. and events at Lansdowne.
You can also walk to Dow's Lake from my house - it's about three blocks. This is where the tulip fest

name: Home in Ottawa · ★4.95 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: "The Glebe" is one of Ottawa's most popular trendy neighbourhoods.  It is one neighbourhood out from the central core and is surrounded by the curve of the Rideau Canal. It has old brick houses and big trees with lots of different architecture, old and new. Our "main street" is an eight block section of Bank Street - Ottawa's main retail road that bisects the city and ends at Parliament Hill. On Bank Street ( a few minutes from my house) you will find many great restaurants, pubs and cafes, as well as unique small shops that attract people from all over the city. There are three grocery stores.  The big Lansdowne complex has the sports stadium, a Whole Foods, retail shopping, the weekend Farmer's Market, many eateries with outdoor patios, a big park, and a Cineplex. It's very lively, especially when there is a game or event on.  The Glebe is also adjacent to Dow's Lake (3 blocks from my house) where the Tulip Festival and Winterlude are held. name: Home in Ottawa · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths
neighborhood_overview: The ByWard Market area is the oldest part of our city.  Before Ottawa was declared the capital, it was a rough lumber town known as Bytown, and was not much larger than the ByWard area.  By the time Canada became a country in 1867, Ottawa had expanded and added the government buildings you will see today -- our neighbourhood remains as a reminder of the modest beginnings Canada enjoyed.
host_about: Geoff and I have lived in our heritage home for 30 years.  Now with our children grown and gone we love to keep our extra rooms full with guests from all over the world. We have a precocious little Welsh Terrier, Wally, who really runs our house!  If you are looking for a family home in the heart of things then we are the place for you. name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.94 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
You will be in Lowertown, Ottawa's oldest neighbourhood, which also includes the ByWard Market. The "Urban Renewal" project has eroded Lowertown's heritage, but Clarence Street (formerly Franklin) and York Street east of King Edward have largely preserved their heritage. Among our block houses, the only house that has kept its stables (as horses were the main means of transport) is the red brick house with a triangular roof just east of King Edward. The houses in the neighbourhood generally date from the late 1890s, when Ottawa was a timber processing and logging city.

Clarence Street begins with the American Embassy in the west (at the market) and continues to the Rideau River in the east. Clarence intersects King Edward Boulevard, formerly a boulevard with trees and benches in the middle of its peninsula. Unlike the pre-urban era of urban renewal when Clarence / Franklin was a busy street, this is no longer the case outside the market area. East of King Edward, Clarence w
host_about:

As a traveller, I have enjoyed AirBnBs in Paris, NYC and Istanbul to name a few, over the past years.  Curious about other cultures and places, I am a University Communications Professor and promote Education Internationally via my work at Canada's Foreign/Global Affairs Department.

As a host, I look forward to making your short (or perhaps longer) stay in Ottawa a most delicious, amazing and memorable one!

May your travels see you discover plenty!

Alex

If you are a business traveller and require convenient accommodation in the heart of the Kanata's high tech sector, stay in this beautiful private house and get to your workplace and after hour amenities in mere minutes.
Come enjoy all that the city of Ottawa has to offer. Our city has festivals year round - Music, Food, Culture, Art and outdoor activities. We have Winterlude and the Rideau Canal skate-way. We have the Tulip festival and we have the National capital marathon. Our sports venues are some of the best in the world - we have NHL Hockey, CFL Football, Fury Soccer and world class Equestrian at Wesley Clover Parks, just to name a few.

My very first trip was to Haiti and my latest expedition was a fabulous  South African safari.  I am also a Personal Travel Designer and I love both five star journeys and budget backpacking. Cheers and hope to see you soon! 
Greg and Valerie

name: Home in Ottawa · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Preston Street is the heart of Ottawa's Little Italy neighbourhood. Renamed Corso Italia to reflect the Italian heritage of the area, it offers tree-lined streets, award-winning Italian and international cuisine and independent boutiques, making this one of Ottawa's most inviting neighborhoods. This is your cycle-friendly rest stop that links the City's two most picturesque cycling paths, the Ottawa River and the Rideau Canal Pathways. Park your bike here and enjoy one of the many sunny patios in this area. Centrally located in west Centretown between Dow's Lake and the Ottawa River, Little Italy is easily accessible to and from anywhere in the city. This is home to some of Ottawa's biggest festivals, Tulip Festival in May, Italian Week in June Blues Fest in July, and GrapeFest in September, but there is always something to do in Little Italy.

https://www.ottawatourism.ca/member/preston-street-bia-little-italy/

Carson Grove - Carson Meadows est un quartier résidentiel situé dans l'est d'Ottawa, au Canada. C'est une communauté relativement calme et paisible, composée principalement de maisons unifamiliales et de maisons de ville.

Le quartier est bordé par le boulevard St. Laurent à l'ouest, le parc de l'Aviation à l'est, la route Ogilvie au nord et l'autoroute Queensway au sud. Il est situé à proximité de plusieurs commodités, notamment des centres commerciaux, des restaurants, des parcs et des écoles.

Carson Grove - Carson Meadows est également bien desservi par les transports en commun, avec plusieurs lignes de bus traversant la région, offrant un accès facile à d'autres parties de la ville. C'est un quartier diversifié avec un mélange de résidents de différentes origines culturelles. Dans l'ensemble, Carson Grove - Carson Meadows est un quartier familial qui offre un style de vie confortable et pratique.

I have toured the world - 200 cities in 61 countries - and I love to explore, travel, eat, cook and read.  My very first trip was to Haiti and my latest expedition was a fabulous  South African safari.  I am also a Personal Travel Designer and I love both five star journeys and budget backpacking.  My favourite poem is Invictus,  and I would describe myself as lucky, blessed, happy, a foodie, an early adopter, endlessly curious,  the wife of Greg and the mother of two fabulous daughters - who are global citizens.  

We feel very fortunate to be able to host so many wonderful guests in Ottawa. 

Cheers and hope to see you soon! 
Greg and Valerie

The building is very safe and has a 24hr security guard like a high end luxury hotel. The building is located right in the heart of downtown and it is a very touristy area. It is recommended to always exercise adequate discretion like when travelling downtown in any metropolitan city. name: Guest suite in Ottawa · ★4.73 · 2 bedrooms · 5 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Look for the identifying plaques on the heritage buildings throughout Sandy Hill. Range Rd., (Embassy Row) is lined with embassies two of which are our neighbors in the back. Pack a picnic and walk 4 minutes to Strathcona Park where children can be seen playing in its sand castle and swings. In the winter you might catch a glimpse of a cross country skier or two. While at the park, stroll along the Ottawa River, home of ducks and two swans, or walk to the park's entrance on Laurier Avenue and make a wish at the fountain. There are more embassies on Laurier but almost directly across the street is the famous Cordon Bleu Culinary Institute. You will need to make advance reservations for lunch or dinner there. BTW: The stop light that is around the corner from the Russian Embassy is Rideau St. which becomes Wellington St. (Direction West...i.e. left turn), address of the Senate & Parliament, Library & Archives and the Bank of Canada.
At the far end of the park you can cross Ottaw
host_about:

Mine was the apartment where friends timed "just dropping in" knowing full well that food, a warm bed, or a respite was always there.  
I'm also a connector/networker and a go-to person who loves people,  travelling, cooking, gardening, interior decorating as well as domestic science. Along with my business degree and over 30 years runnung a Canada-wide financial services brokerage, I've found a perfect fit in accommodations both in Canada and in Jamaica.

Cheers!

Honest, hard working, fair, kind, generous.

My favorite cities include: New York, Rome, Paris, Cannes, San Tropez, Madrid, Helsinki, Warsaw, Krakow, Gdansk, Port Antonia Jamaica, San Diego, Laguna Beach, La Jolla - California, Naples, Vero Beach, Palm Beach, Key West - Florida, Ottawa, Toronto, Vancouver, Montreal - Canada!
Books I like: Power of Now, War and Peace, Crime Fiction novels, Biographical books. Learning is a passion.
Movies: Not blockbusters but good movies that have strong scripts, acting and powerful directing. I love my family more than anything in the world especially my son David Martin-Konopacki.
I also love the arts including: theatre, opera, live music (symphony, rock, folk, classical, new age, peaceful meditative sound)  and art galleries. Creativity is very important to me...

Your needs are important and I want to honor you on your trip to our place. Nothing beats the best panoramic views of the town in a condo up above the city.... Also what helps is knowing whats going on in Prescott....Where is the good band that weekend? the best local restaurants? galleries?  The best local lake for a wonderful picnic and romantic afternoon in the pines?( just 7 min. drive from here by the way!!)
My belief  is that we are all created equal and that everyone should be treated with kindness and respect. (Animals too!) There is not enough kindness in the world in my opinion, but we can make a big difference with our attitude and action -- one day at a time; one smile at a time. Love and Kindness is all that is worthwhile...

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.88 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The neighbourhood is a well-established French Canadian part of Ottawa. Rockcliffe and the Ottawa River are a short distance to the north and the Rideau River is just to the west. There is a lovely pathway along the east side of the Rideau River which runs for 10 km south to the Hog's Back Falls Park and 3 km north to where the Rideau River drops over a 9-metre cliff into the Ottawa River. There are some good views of Downtown Ottawa from the falls. 13 minutes' walk to the north of my home is Richelieu Park, which is home to urban Ottawa's last surviving sugar bush where over 1,000 maple trees are tapped. It's the only urban sugar bush in North America. The dates for the Maple Sugar Fest at the the Vanier Sugar Shack can be found the city's website.

This community is very fortunate in having the Rideau River as a barrier between it and downtown! Roads with commuter traffic completely bypass it. This makes it a best-of-both-worlds place - very quiet and neighbourly but wit
host_about: I am pretty good at responding to guests' and would-be guests' enquiries except when I am travelling. I enjoy camping and travelling in remote locations such as in the wilds of Central America where WiFi is either very limited or completely unavailable. I do try to have a family member check my Airbnb messages so that people who contact me to ask questions or to make a reservation can be informed that I am away and of the date of my return., and their booking requests can also be accepted. Almost inevitably, there can be delays so please be patient!  Many thanks for your understanding.

name: Guest suite in Ottawa · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:

Walk South on Preston and explore little shops and cafés or wonder to Dow's Lake and enjoy beautiful parks and Canada's Arboretum (Experimental Farms) - the perfect place for a picnic, sitting next to the famed Rideau Canal. On your trek South on Preston I recommend stopping in for a bite at Pubwells, pickup a picnic snack, or your deli and cheeses at Luciano's, a coffee or snack at Bridgehead Coffee, or brunch at any of Little Italy's restaurants. Go East on Somerset Street and explore Ottawa's Chinatown or head West and hip-it-up in the up and coming Hintonburg neighbourhood. You can also walk to the core of downtown or Parliament Hill in 20 minutes or take a 5 minute bus/taxi/uber ride.

Relax, play, enjoy and stay right in the heart of it all!

Please join me in explOring my little slice of heaven. See you soon.
Cheers!

The peaceful paths of the Ottawa river are nearby and the vibrant Byward Market is only a short ride over the St. Patrick Street bridge. Village Suites is walking distance to the shops of Beechwood Avenue where good coffee, fresh flowers, warm bread or a bus stop are at your fingertips.
host_about:

The reason Village Suites came to be was to provide people with the kind of accommodation that I would like to stay in; clean, stylish with a place for everything and everything in its place. Having traveled extensively through work and also with my family, I really appreciate having the "right" place to stay. Our locations are in safe, walkable neighborhoods with every convenience at your fingertips. This account was previously managed by my husband Dave, so you will see his name in a lot of the historical reviews. We didn't want to start a new account and lose all the good press!

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.90 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
You are in the heart of an established centuries old area called the Glebe, a very hip and urban suburb that really has all you need for entertainment & shopping. Lined by beautiful Victorian style homes with “Ma and Pa” shops from boutiques, bakeries, grocers, banks, pharmacies, specialty cafés, fine dining, casual dining, and pubs.
You are a five minute walk to the scenic Rideau canal, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, where you can bike/walk/run along tree-lined paths or ice-skate in the winter along the longest skating canal in the world.
Parliament Hill is close enough to walk but easy public transit on OC-Transpo (a two-minute walk) will have you there in ten minutes.
The Lansdowne development has brought a new vibe with trendy nightclubs and restaurants, green space with skatepark and play structures, a Whole Foods grocery store and a modern theatre build around the Lansdowne stadium which is home to the Ottawa Red Blacks (CFL), the Ottawa Fury (ASL) and the Ott
host_about: My wife and I have settled back in Canada after eight years of living overseas in India, Dubai and Hong Kong.  We loved our travels but also love Ottawa, our beautiful Canadian capital.  There is so much to do and see here and we live right in the heart of this amazing city!  We look forward to hosting you for your Ottawa visit.  Thankyou, Bart and Ariane

name: Home in Ottawa · ★4.91 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Westboro (often referred to as Westboro Village) is an area in the west end of Ottawa, Ontario. Located along the Ottawa River, Island Park Drive defines the Westboro's eastern border, while The Ottawa River defines its northern border.
Westboro Village is one of the most unique and diverse neighbourhoods in Ottawa. You’ll enjoy tree-lined streets, shop in one-of-a-kind boutiques and popular stores, spend time in welcoming outdoor spaces, dine at Ottawa’s trendiest spots and enjoy the natural beauty of Westboro Beach and the scenic views of Gatineau Hills - all within walking distance.
host_about: Living from the heART. Consciously curating a meaningful reality day by day where life is all the work and all the play. Smiling, connecting, and pondering; I dream more than I sleep. I love plants, making beautiful spaces and meandering while writing poetry in my head. Interested in all things creative. I've been teaching yoga and mindfulness for the last 8 years and it has brought me so much joy. Highly sensitive empath - it's my superpower!

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.89 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath

We are also only about a few minute walk to Lansdowne Park which has a variety of different restaurants (Joey's, Locals, Milestones, Jack Astor's, etc...), movie theatre (Cineplex VIP), grocery stores (Whole Foods), a park and playground for children and TD Place. TD Place is home of our CFL team the Ottawa Redblacks (football), Ottawa Fury (soccer) and OHL 67's (hockey), as well as many concerts and events.

The Ottawa Rideau Canal is just down the street from the apartment, perfect for walking or running along. There is also a dock nearby where you can rent canoes + kayaks + paddle boats + city bicycles in the summer months.

name: Cottage in Ottawa · ★4.94 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath

Please note: Constance Bay is an adorable little beach town, but there isn’t a grocery store right there so please plan accordingly. The closest real grocery store is about 20 minutes away in Kanata (Sobey’s on March Road). There are 3 restaurants that do amazing pizza, chinese/thai, and/or breakfast and a general store, LCBO/beer store, pharmacy, and ice cream place. Some guests have seemed shocked that the cottage isn’t right downtown Ottawa with every city amenity imaginable, so I like to forewarn people in case you aren't familiar with the beauty that is Constance Bay.

There is a community centre with a children's and toddler's park a 5 minute drive away. There you will also find a skateboarding park, soccer fields, baseball diamonds, and outdoor rink in the winter.

There are 900 acres of protected forest area a stones throw away, perfect for hiking, biking, snowshoeing, cross-country skiing, snowmobiling, and ATVing.

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.94 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Hintonburg is a lively and hip neighbourhood. Special features that are just a few minutes away by foot from the apartment include:

1. Wellington Street: home to lots of restaurants and cute stores. A small grocery store is walking distance to the apartment. Large chain grocery stores are better reached by bike, bus, or car.

2. The Parkdale Market: this lively market is open daily from April to November, 6am to 6pm. You can find an array of fresh fruit, vegetables, and plants there.

3. Laroche Park: offers a large open field with two baseball diamonds, a children's play area, and an off-leash dog park.

4. Gatineau River Trail: you can enjoy a relaxing walk, run, bike ride, or (in the winter) cross-country skiing along the river. You can also use the trail for a scenic commute to downtown.

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.97 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are in the middle of a quiet street which coincidentally links up to all that Westboro has to offer.

A few steps to the South is Ottawa’s premier pedestrian main street with the best of new restaurants, pubs, specialty coffee and shopping as well as MEC and the adventure outfitting retail cluster that accompanies it. Every convenience is also there in the way of pharmacy, post office, dry cleaning, health food stores, etc. Yoga studios abound and several churches are close. The Maplelawn heritage garden and historic manor house (with restaurant - best steaks in town) are also around the corner. The Byron linear park offers a fine walk about and is filled with the tastes and smiles of the outdoor Westboro food and farmers market every Saturday May through October.

A few steps to the North and you come across the panoramic Ottawa river. Westboro beach is the best swimming spot in town, kayaks and canoes lay about with volleyball and movie nights upon occas
host_about:
Having enjoyed staying as AirBnB guests when travelling with our kids over the years we are excited to become hosts to other travellers now that our kids have flown the nest and we have retired.  

As long time affectionate residents of Ottawa, we are always amenable to sharing our appreciation of the city's highlights and opportunities.  After careers in the education and cultural sectors we are also happy to share what we know of the city's rich history.

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.57 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
You are located seconds away from the canal where you can hop on a bike or walking path for a scenic route to Museums, Lansdowne, The Byward Market, The Glebe, Preston street, Tulip festival, Winterlude and much more.

Parliament Hill and the Byward Market is about a 25 minute walk/5 min drive or ten min bike ride away.

Join some friends for brunch, lunch or dinner, and then hit the shops for the highest quality food products, fashions and cutting edge trends. See and be seen until the wee hours at one of our hip nightspots.
Morning, noon and night the ByWard Market has something just for you.

Established by Lt-Col. John By in 1826, the ByWard Market is one of Canada's oldest and largest public markets. The legendary builder of the Rideau Canal, Colonel By himself laid out the street plan of the Market, designating George Street and York Street to be extra wide to accommodate the creation of a public market and gathering place.

host_about:
It’s a Beautiful Day in my Neighborhood!  Glad you cruised by...

I live a life full of adventure, purpose, and laughs. 

I have enjoyed a diverse and eclectic career which has led me to where I am now...with the Ottawa Fire Department as my "day" job, CEO of a clean technology company as my passion job, and a stand up comic and Stadium MC/ Host for the Ottawa Redblacks CFL team as my part time jobs...and of course, being a Superhost to a unique AirBnB at my residence in Ottawa. 

While globetrotting over the past twenty years I discovered what works at an Airbnb and have curated my own space to be clean, comfortable, and convenient for my guests. My Airbnb meets the highest standards... my own. 

As a life long Ottawan I know the city like no one else. As a younger man I was the doorman at the Chateau Laurier (Ottawa's most iconic, historic hotel) where I learned the importance of guest service while attending to a VIP clientele of Canadian and international public figures. 

I am bilingual in French and English.

I have traveled the world performing stand up comedy.

I have worked with children affected by HIV.

I am, by virtue of cultural and familial upbringing, polite and considerate.

I am a huge proponent of the circular economy and offer a low-waste space at my BnB.

I am sure I will enjoy meeting you if you have read this far and are still reading.

- Geoffrey

Neighbourhood has a few fairly nearby grocery stores, namely a wonderful Farm Boy, and large Loblaws as well as a Metro. There are a few pizza parlours and a Thai take-out place nearby too. Across the Ottawa riverside Parkway is a very green path for walkers, joggers and cyclists, which passes through a marvelous wildlife conservation area. It’s along the Ottawa River, so very green, plenty of trees, geese, ducks and other birds. If you’re lucky you’ll see a beaver! A beautiful oasis of nature, just a few minutes away from this beautiful 20th-floor home!

There are also plenty of indoor and outdoor tennis courts, nearby. Britannia Beach, where there is friendly volleyball and public swimming, is about a 20-minute walk away.

There should be an LRT by 2024!

name: Home in Ottawa · ★4.67 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Beaverbrook is bounded by March Road to the north and east, Campeau Drive to the south, and just to the west of Carr, Pentland, Tiffany and Reaney Crescents. Beaverbrook is one of the original neighbourhoods of the former city of Kanata.

The area remained mainly agricultural until the 1960s, when it was developed from rural land that was acquired by Bill Teron. The neighbourhood was built using a model community approach, which made Beaverbrook into an independent neighbourhood that has its own unique character and commercial services.

name: Loft in Ottawa · ★4.94 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
You are in the heart of an established centuries old area called the Glebe, a very hip and urban neighborhood that really has all you need for entertainment & shopping. Lined by beautiful Victorian style homes with “Ma and Pa” shops from boutiques, bakeries, grocers, banks, pharmacies, specialty cafés, fine dining, casual dining, and pubs.
You are a five minute walk to the scenic Rideau canal, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, where you can bike/walk/run along tree-lined paths or ice-skate in the winter along the longest skating canal in the world.
Parliament Hill is close enough to walk but easy public transit on OC-Transpo (a two-minute walk) will have you there in ten minutes.
The Lansdowne development has brought a new vibe with trendy nightclubs and restaurants, green space with skatepark and play structures, a Whole Foods grocery store and a modern theatre build around the Lansdowne stadium which is home to the Ottawa Red Blacks (CFL), the Ottawa Fury (ASL) and t
host_about: My wife and I have settled back in Canada after eight years of living overseas in India, Dubai and Hong Kong.  We loved our travels but also love Ottawa, our beautiful Canadian capital. I am a firm believer in the power of technology to greatly improve communication, connections, comfort and reach. I have over 20 years background in Information Technology consulting work, managing large scale Digital Transformation projects, Customer Relationship Management, Digital Marketing and Social Media. We also strongly believe in the new sharing economy as well as Airbnb's philosophy of inclusion, belonging and providing great experiences to all our guests by sharing beautiful homes in great destinations. Come, stay with us and experience the difference.

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.88 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Hintonburg is a lively and hip neighbourhood. Special features that are just a few minutes away by foot from the apartment include:

1. Wellington Street: home to lots of restaurants and cute stores. A small grocery store is walking distance to the apartment. Large chain grocery stores are better reached by bike, bus, or car.

2. The Parkdale Market: this lively market is open daily from April to November, 6am to 6pm. You can find an array of fresh fruit, vegetables, and plants there.

3. Laroche Park: offers a large open field with two baseball diamonds, a children's play area, and an off-leash dog park.

4. Gatineau River Trail: you can enjoy a relaxing walk, run, bike ride, or (in the winter) cross-country skiing along the river. You can also use the trail for a scenic commute to downtown.
host_about:
I love to travel - to see new places, experience different cultures, eat local dishes, and meet people from all corners of the globe.

I am excited to welcome guests from all walks of life to Ottawa and aim to give them a warm, welcoming home during their stay.

name: Home in Ottawa · ★4.99 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
You are in the heart of an established centuries old area called the Glebe, a very hip and urban suburb that really has all you need for entertainment & shopping. Lined by beautiful Victorian style homes with “Ma and Pa” shops from boutiques, bakeries, grocers, banks, pharmacies, specialty cafés, fine dining, casual dining, and pubs.
You are a five minute walk to the scenic Rideau canal, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, where you can bike/walk/run along tree-lined paths or ice-skate in the winter along the longest skating canal in the world.
Parliament Hill is close enough to walk but easy public transit on OC-Transpo (a two-minute walk) will have you there in ten minutes.
The Lansdowne development has brought a new vibe with trendy nightclubs and restaurants, green space with skatepark and play structures, a Whole Foods grocery store and a modern theatre build around the Lansdowne stadium which is home to the Ottawa Red Blacks (CFL), the Ottawa Fury (ASL) and the Ott
host_about: My wife and I have settled back in Canada after eight years of living overseas in India, Dubai and Hong Kong.  We loved our travels but also love Ottawa, our beautiful Canadian capital.  There is so much to do and see here and we live right in the heart of this amazing city!  We look forward to hosting you for your Ottawa visit.  Thankyou, Bart and Ariane

name: Guest suite in Ottawa · ★4.94 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Alta Vista is a highly residential neighbourhood with a strong community, several schools, churches, and community centres. It also has a vast amount of greenspace and parks, much of which is part of the Alta Vista Transportation Corridor Environment.

The OC Transpo Transitway also runs through Alta Vista, with two stations in the neighbourhood itself (Pleasant Park and Riverside) as well as two just outside (Billings Bridge and Smyth), serving as a vital transit link to the rest of the city.

The General Campus of the Ottawa Hospital, and The Children's Hospital of Eastern Ontario are located just on the north side of Smyth Road, in Riverview, while the Riverside Campus of the Ottawa Hospital is located at Smyth and Riverside Drive. There are two shopping malls in and around Alta Vista: the Billings Bridge Plaza Shopping Centre at Bank Street and Riverside and the Elmvale Shopping Centre at St. Laurent and Smyth.

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.76 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Hintonburg is a lively and hip neighbourhood. Special features that are just a few minutes away by foot from the apartment include:

1. Wellington Street: home to lots of restaurants and cute stores. A small grocery store is walking distance to the apartment. Large chain grocery stores are better reached by bike, bus, or car.

2. The Parkdale Market: this lively market is open daily from April to November, 6am to 6pm. You can find an array of fresh fruit, vegetables, and plants there.

3. Laroche Park: offers a large open field with two baseball diamonds, a children's play area, and an off-leash dog park.

4. Gatineau River Trail: you can enjoy a relaxing walk, run, bike ride, or (in the winter) cross-country skiing along the river. You can also use the trail for a scenic commute to downtown.
host_about:
I love to travel - to see new places, experience different cultures, eat local dishes, and meet people from all corners of the globe.

I am excited to welcome guests from all walks of life to Ottawa and aim to give them a warm, welcoming home during their stay.

It is on a quiet residential street yet very close to everything, including parliament/byward market. Great restaurants, bars, coffee shops, museums - all nearby.

Steps to Lansdowne Park/TD Place Stadium if your coming to watch your favorite sports team. Lansdowne Park features everything from relaxation to recreation. Landsdowne Park is a must see destination for tourists, a hub to connect neighbourhoods, a quite oasis, a destination for shopping, restaurants and entertainment. It has something to offer for everyone to enjoy.

Steps to the Canal - beautiful trail for a morning run and a refreshing bike ride. Make sure to check out the Byward Market and Parliament in downtown core, minutes away!

name: Home in Ottawa · ★4.95 · 4 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Sandy hill is situated within walking distance of the ByWard Market, so shares many services and shops of the market, including grocery stores and the transitway. Located close to downtown, Sandy Hill has excellent public transportation, a large shopping complex, and many schools to serve its families. Sandy Hill is bounded by Rideau-Besserer-Daly Avenue on the north, both Highway 417 and Nicholas Street to the south, the Rideau River to the east, and the Rideau Canal to the west. This neighbourhood includes the community of Strathcona Heights and the University of Ottawa.
As a residential community, Sandy Hill dates back to the 1870s and was the wealthiest and most prestigious neighbourhood in the Ottawa area up until the early 20th century. Some of the neighbourhood’s notable locations include Laurier House, the residence of Prime Ministers Sir Wilfred Laurier and William Lyon Mackenzie-King, and the house of WWI ace Billy Bishop, which was later inhabited by another Prime Mini
host_about: I am a creative soul that loves to travel and explore the world.  Born in England but along my travels made Canada my home and native land.  My life’s motto is to be present and live in the moment.  As an artist, I love to create and discover new things and as your host, I have tried to create a modern, minimalist, boutique hotel style experience for you.  I welcome you to my home and I hope you enjoy it as much as I have.

neighborhood_overview:
-Right by the vibrant ByWard market where you will find the best restaurants, boutiques and nightlife.
-A short walk to Parliament hill, downtown/Spark street and the best museums of the city (National Gallery of Canada, National Art Center, etc.)
-A short walk to the Rideau canal, the Fairmount Chateau Laurier and the Ottawa River

Stay in the heart of Montreal's  trendiest neighbourhoods.

Explore local businesses from the comfort of our elegantly designed apartments.

neighborhood_overview:
Excellent and conveniently located in Bridlewood Kanata South.

Steps away from bus stops
Minutes away from High way 417
Minutes away from Restaurents, gas station, Tim hortons and Star bucks
Minutes away from Trans Canada Trails for hiking, biking.

Shopping
With such close proximity to both Kanata, Bayshore and Bells Corners and their large shopping clusters, this community is quiet.

Recreation
The community has lots of parks and forested areas, and has the Trans-Canada Trail, connecting into downtown Ottawa, and east & west to other parts of Canada. Nearby in Glen Cairn Park is an indoor pool, racquet courts, and public library, and there is a running track beside AY Jackson High School. The east edge of the neighbourhood adjoins the Stony Swamp Conservation Area which extends east all the way to Bells Corners.

name: Guest suite in Ottawa · ★4.95 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Want to enjoy a great coffee, eat in one of the best vegetarian restaurants in Ottawa, or hit a farmer's market on a Saturday morning? No problem - they are all just a 5 minute walk away.

Walk just a few hundred metres south on Main Street to Sula Wok for delicious Asian street food or Vespa Wine Bar for delicious wines and Italian fare. The Green Door restaurant, an Ottawa icon, is just a few steps further for a delicious vegetarian meal. On Saturdays from 9 am-3 pm in summer there is also a farmer's market in the parking lot next to the restaurant. We can also recommend a number of great, reasonably priced Vietnamese restaurants just a little further afield (25-30 min walk).

Other cafes and restaurants, a large grocery store (Loblaw's), and a liquor store are just a 5-10 min walk away. Right around the corner is NU, a local no-waste grocery store. There is also a great Korean grocery (Seoul Mart) right behind Loblaw's if you love Asian food like us!
host_about: We are a well-travelled family of four who have settled back in Ottawa after living and working in Vietnam and the UAE for many years. After staying in dozens of amazing Airbnb's on our travels, we now look forward to hosting guests from around the world in the beautiful capital of Canada. We love any activity in the outdoors, cooking delicious food (especially Vietnamese!), and enjoying stimulating conversation with a glass of good wine, a cup of organic coffee, or a mug of hot herbal tea in hand.  Let's have one together!

name: Home in Ottawa · ★4.99 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Located in the Civic Hospital area and directly in front of the expanse of the historic experimental farm, you’ll wake to bright beautiful sunrises through the large living room window and enjoy the western sun on the rooftop deck or in the kitchen through the wall to wall patio door. The farm is a great location to walk or ride bikes and serves as the most beautiful scenic route to downtown as you pass along Dow’s lake and the Rideau canal.

This is an ideal location since it allows one to have excellent access to Centretown just 7 minutes away but also allows you to enjoy other arguably better parts of the city which reflect more on its character and offerings.

Hintonburg is a hip little neighbourhood with great social spots and is located just minutes away. East of Hintonburg is Little Italy and China town. 5 minutes west of the home is Westboro. These neighbourhoods have excellent restaurants, cafes and bars.
The home also has great access to the Glebe
host_about:

name: Guest suite in Ottawa · ★4.96 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
PLACES TO VISIT

Parliament Hill
​
Parliament Hill is an area of Crown land on the southern banks of the Ottawa River in downtown Ottawa, Ontario, Canada. Its Gothic revival suite of buildings is the home of the Parliament of Canada and has architectural elements of national symbolic importance.

Little Italy

Little Italy is the cultural centre of Ottawa's Italian community that features 42 restaurants with cuisines from around the world! There’s more than just great food and shopping here - Little Italy hosts many interesting things to do! From virtual reality games to comedy, live theatre, murder mystery, live music and even magic, there are many great options to entertain families, adults and kids of all ages.

Museums

Home to seven of Canada’s nine national museums, Ottawa is the mecca for culture vultures, historical enthusiasts and Canadiana buffs. Add these national museums to your Ottawa itinerary:
​
- Na

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: One of Orleans best features is the lovely natural habitat and gorgeous beach at Petrie Island. The Island hosts a variety of events over the year such as Canada Day festivities and Carivibe. Spend the day swimming, hiking, exploring the beach or stop at the marina for a snack or a boat rental. http://www.oziles.com/rentals.html There are farmer's markets, festivals, great bakeries, eateries, local brewing companies, bike paths, and entertainment. Set in a semi-rural residential area its a five minute drive to the country or hop on the ferry for a visit to Quebec.
host_about:
My favourite way to travel is by staying at B&Bs and exploring the local area for farmer's markets, artisans, and meeting local people whether its a casual conversation at a local mom & pop diner or business. I never order food without checking with the locals for their faves and I rarely eat at chain food restaurants when there's a better local option. I would rather meet local people and get a sense of their community. I love to cook and with three kids & a husband to feed that's a good combination because boy, can they eat! Best vacations are family vacations. My teenagers still love to travel with us. I guess that says something about our travel adventures, and its a good thing! :) When we travel we make stops to see local curiosities and historic landmarks, often unplanned, screeching halt roadside and we pile out to check out a interesting relic or historic plaque/scene. I tidy a hotel room before I leave as if I was heading out of my own home and I tip the hotel staff. We love the theatre, live musical performances, animated kids movies, good local food and finding humour even in the worst of situations.
I love to meet new people and get to know them when I'm hosting, and I also respect their privacy or preference to be alone. I'm attentive to the guest's needs and like to accommodate as much as possible the guest's special requests.
My motto is do it now because someday I'll be sleeping the sleep of forever and I don't want to miss anything while I'm still here!

You have access to some of the best restaurants in the city, such as Das Lokal which is only 2mins away. Pili Pili Charcoaled grilled chicken which is a must have is just across the street and Bridgehead coffee shop is right around the corner. Don’t forget to check out the best French Baker which is located on Murray.

If you’re looking for the night life say no more only 5 minutes away located on Clarence, York and George Street. You will also discover an array of patios and many more restaurants too.

host_about:
Hi! I'm Greg, Calgary born and happily transplanted to Ottawa. Educated and employed as an Economist,  I am also a trained Heritage Carpenter.  Owning and maintaining real estate is a passion of mine.  Giving back to the community is important to me and our business is a "Champion of Hope" financial donor for a local men's shelter in Ottawa, Ontario. 

Hi! I'm Valerie, and have been living in Ottawa for most of my life. My professional background is international development with a focus on finance and project management. I have toured the world - 200 cities in 61 countries - and I love to explore, travel, eat, cook and read.  My very first trip was to Haiti and my latest expedition was a fabulous  South African safari.  I am also a Personal Travel Designer and I love both five star journeys and budget backpacking.  My favourite poem is Invictus,  and I would describe myself as lucky, blessed, happy, a foodie, an early adopter, endlessly curious,  the wife of Greg and the mother of two fabulous daughters - who are global citizens.  

We feel very fortunate to be able to host so many wonderful guests in Ottawa. 

Cheers and hope to see you soon! 
Greg and Valerie

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.49 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
My Apartment is located in the Downtown Glebe, a local, hip and nostalgic neighbourhood bustling with local businesses and an irresistible trendy vibe.

It is on a quiet residential street yet very close to everything, including parliament/byward market. Great restaurants, bars, coffee shops, museums - all nearby.

Steps to Lansdowne Park/TD Place Stadium if your coming to watch your favorite sports team. Lansdowne Park features everything from relaxation to recreation. Landsdowne Park is a must see destination for tourists, a hub to connect neighbourhoods, a quite oasis, a destination for shopping, restaurants and entertainment. It has something to offer for everyone to enjoy.

Steps to the Canal - beautiful trail for a morning run and a refreshing bike ride. Make sure to check out the Byward Market and Parliament in downtown core, minutes away!
host_about: I am a corporate lawyer that loves to travel and spend time with family and friends. When travelling I only use Airbnb because it allows me to meet new people and bring me closer to the local culture. I have stayed in beautiful homes and had hosts that made my stay unforgettable. name: Home in Ottawa · ★4.89 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Old-Ottawa-East is small neighbourhood was originally the suburban community of Archville that was incorporated as the village of Ottawa East in 1888. In 1907, it was amalgamated with the growing community of Ottawa. Running through the centre of the neighbourhood is Main Street, which was the central road of Archville, but which is not particularly central to modern Ottawa. The neighbourhood is home to Saint Paul University and Immaculata High School.

Old-Ottawa-East is located south of Nicholas Street and between the Rideau Canal and the Rideau River.  The new Flora Footbridge connects the community to The Glebe.

neighborhood_overview:
Overbook is a rapidly developing neighbourhood located in the east end of Ottawa. It is located across the Rideau River, from the neighbourhoods of Lower Town and Sandy Hill, just to the south Rockcliffe Park, and New Edinburgh.

Small-scale businesses line Donald Street on the neighbourhood's northern area. While the neighbourhood is quiet and residential, it is situated conveniently to St. Laurent Shopping Centre with anchors including Sears and The Bay, along with Bath and Body Works, Guess, SportChek, and many others. Nearby, you can also find The Ottawa Trainyards featuring WalMart and Marshall's. Even more shopping is available on both Montreal Road and Beechwood Avenue.

If you're looking for great Italian food, there is no shortage here in Overbrook. Louis' Restaurant and Pizzeria and Pizzaro's are two excellent, family-friendly restaurants centrally located in the neighbourhood.

Hello! My name is Tara, and I live in a beautiful neighbourhood in the core of Ottawa! The famous Rideau Canal is just five minutes away and provides excellent recreational activities. I like to skate in the winter or use one of the trails to bike along the water in the summer. If you are looking to visit Canada's capital city, our Airbnb accommodations offer affordable pricing and easy access to a variety of activities. 

I love to travel and enjoy the experience that Airbnbs offer. I strive to provide the high-quality experience that I have come to expect from Airbnb. 

If you want to visit, don't hesitate to reach out! I would love to chat about how we can make my space work best for your needs.

host_about:
Hi! I'm Greg, Calgary born and happily transplanted to Ottawa. Educated and employed as an Economist,  I am also a trained Heritage Carpenter.  Owning and maintaining real estate is a passion of mine.  Giving back to the community is important to me and our business is a "Champion of Hope" financial donor for a local men's shelter in Ottawa, Ontario. 

Hi! I'm Valerie, and have been living in Ottawa for most of my life. My professional background is international development with a focus on finance and project management. I have toured the world - 200 cities in 61 countries - and I love to explore, travel, eat, cook and read.  My very first trip was to Haiti and my latest expedition was a fabulous  South African safari.  I am also a Personal Travel Designer and I love both five star journeys and budget backpacking.  My favourite poem is Invictus,  and I would describe myself as lucky, blessed, happy, a foodie, an early adopter, endlessly curious,  the wife of Greg and the mother of two fabulous daughters - who are global citizens.  

We feel very fortunate to be able to host so many wonderful guests in Ottawa. 

Cheers and hope to see you soon! 
Greg and Valerie

Take a walk down Somerset street and you’ll find an amazing selection of the best Chinese, Korea, Vietnamese, Thai and/or Indian food in the city!

Take a walk down Preston Street and you can find a variety of small restaurants, some gelato or some beers at the pub.

Head down to Dow’s lake to enjoy a skate on the canal in the winter. Check out the tulips in the spring or just enjoy a walk by the water.

If you’re headed to Ottawa for bluesfest or another festival at Lebreton Flats, our Airbnb is the perfect spot to stay.

name: Guest suite in Ottawa · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: Located on the eastern edges of the former village of Orleans, the neighbourhood offers more than just a suburban setting. There are lots of good quality restaurants and Orleans prides itself on being a 'foodie neighbourhood' from food trucks to great steaks and fusion delights. There are two cinemas, a theatre and arts centre with transit and shopping centre nearby. By all means our jewel is the Petrie Island Beach & wetlands area to hike, swim, fish, or visit the marina to pick up some bait or a cold drink. Other landmarks include the Cumberland Heritage Village, and the Cumberland Farmer's Market less than five minutes from our Airbnb. Orleans has a series of connected pathways for biking and walking as well as linking to Ottawa's downtown. Much to see, do and enjoy.
host_about:
My favourite way to travel is by staying at B&Bs and exploring the local area for farmer's markets, artisans, and meeting local people whether its a casual conversation at a local mom & pop diner or business. I never order food without checking with the locals for their faves and I rarely eat at chain food restaurants when there's a better local option. I would rather meet local people and get a sense of their community. I love to cook and with three kids & a husband to feed that's a good combination because boy, can they eat! Best vacations are family vacations. My teenagers still love to travel with us. I guess that says something about our travel adventures, and its a good thing! :) When we travel we make stops to see local curiosities and historic landmarks, often unplanned, screeching halt roadside and we pile out to check out a interesting relic or historic plaque/scene. I tidy a hotel room before I leave as if I was heading out of my own home and I tip the hotel staff. We love the theatre, live musical performances, animated kids movies, good local food and finding humour even in the worst of situations.
I love to meet new people and get to know them when I'm hosting, and I also respect their privacy or preference to be alone. I'm attentive to the guest's needs and like to accommodate as much as possible the guest's special requests.
My motto is do it now because someday I'll be sleeping the sleep of forever and I don't want to miss anything while I'm still here!

name: Home in Ottawa · 3 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Vanier is a historically French-Canadian neighbourhood just a few kilometres east of downtown Ottawa. In this residential area, you can visit an urban sugar shack, browse at a farmers’ market, cycle along the Rideau River or visit a museum celebrating the neighbourhood’s storied past.

Vanier is home to a wide range of independent shops, mainly along Montreal Road in the heart of the neighbourhood and lively Beechwood Avenue on Vanier’s northern edge. The Beechwood Market in Optimiste Park is a fun place to shop for local products from June through October.

name: Home in Ottawa · ★4.60 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.98 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
host_about:
Hi everyone! 
I am excited to be a part of this community and to be able to help people feel right at home. 

I am originally from Oakville, Ontario, but I lived in Munich, Germany for a few years growing up. Being in Europe, so many great travel destinations were nearby, and this gave me a taste for travel and tourism! 

I moved to Ottawa to pursue an undergraduate degree in Biomedical Mechanical Engineering at the University of Ottawa in 2014, and have been here ever since. I'm now studying to obtain a Ph.D. in Biomedical Engineering. Becoming a host on Airbnb has been a great way for me to offset my tuition fees (thank you to all my past and future guests!).

I know what it's like to be a tourist in Ottawa, so I am happy to be a host here and to help guests make the most of their stay. I would be thrilled to be your next Airbnb host! :)
