name: Home in Ottawa · ★4.92 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
Guest suite in Ottawa · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
ALTA VISTA
Pleasant Park B&B is located in the beautiful Alta Vista neighbourhood which boasts one of the oldest tree canopies in Ottawa. We are only a 5 minute walk from the historic Billings Bridge Estate.

AMENITIES
Groceries, LCBO and restaurants are a short 15 minute walk (or one transit stop) away at Billings Bridge Shopping Centre. Walk (20 min) or drive (5 min) to the canal, Lansdowne and TD Place along Bank Street and enjoy plenty of cafes, eateries, and antique shops along the way.

ACTIVITIES
The Rideau River trail is located at the bottom of Pleasant Park Road. This is an excellent trail for running and cycling in the summer, and cross country skiing in the winter. Paddle boards are available for rent in the summer at Billings Bridge.
host_about: I live in Ottawa with my wife, Alex, and our infant daughter. We're a young family with a passion for travel and love meeting new people wherever we go.  Some of our favourite trips include a jaunt to Dawson City in the Yukon and hiking the Laugavegur trail in Iceland.

name: Home in Ottawa · ★5.0 · 4 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Britannia Village is well-known for its stunning architecture, with a number of them designated as heritage landmarks.

The neighbourhood has no shortage of recreational activities. You will find loads of greenspace, perfect for a picnic. Located between Carling Avenue and the river, the park is accessible on Ottawa's bike path system. In addition, the park features Brittania Beach, a great spot to soak up some sun and enjoy the beautiful surroundings.

Given its location, Britannia Village provides quick and easy access to various points across the city. Downtown can be reached via car in 20 minutes, or 35 minutes by bus.

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
Guesthouse in Ottawa · ★4.91 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Sandy Hill, also known as Côte-de-Sable in French, is a bilingual and historically significant neighborhood situated just east of downtown Ottawa. It is positioned between the Rideau Canal to the west and the Rideau River to the east, making it conveniently accessible to all of Ottawa's summer attractions. This neighbourhood, once considered one of Ottawa's most prestigious areas, still preserves many grand estates and beautiful historic homes.
Sandy Hill is very safe and has a remarkably diverse community, home to a wide range of residents, including students, middle-class families, and affluent individuals.
Its rich mix of inhabitants contributes to its vibrant and dynamic character, making it a unique and welcoming part of Ottawa.
host_about: I am a professor at the University of Ottawa. I love travelling and often travel for work and pleasure. I usually stay at Airbnb places around the world. I think it is the best way to immerse yourself in the local life.  I also love to welcome people to my place and share with them our experience of living in the heart of Canada’s capital.

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Hintonburg is a lively and hip neighbourhood. Special features that are just a few minutes away by foot from the apartment include:

1. Wellington Street: home to lots of restaurants and cute stores. A small grocery store is walking distance to the apartment. Large chain grocery stores are better reached by bike, bus, or car.

2. The Parkdale Market: this lively market is open daily from April to November, 6am to 6pm. You can find an array of fresh fruit, vegetables, and plants there.

3. Laroche Park: offers a large open field with two baseball diamonds, a children's play area, and an off-leash dog park.

4. Gatineau River Trail: you can enjoy a relaxing walk, run, bike ride, or (in the winter) cross-country skiing along the river. You can also use the trail for a scenic commute to downtown.
host_about:

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.83 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Overbook is a rapidly developing neighbourhood located in the east end of Ottawa. It is located across the Rideau River, from the neighbourhoods of Lower Town and Sandy Hill, just to the south Rockcliffe Park, and New Edinburgh.

Small-scale businesses line Donald Street on the neighbourhood's northern area. While the neighbourhood is quiet and residential, it is situated conveniently to St. Laurent Shopping Centre with anchors including Sears and The Bay, along with Bath and Body Works, Guess, SportChek, and many others. Nearby, you can also find The Ottawa Trainyards featuring WalMart and Marshall's. Even more shopping is available on both Montreal Road and Beechwood Avenue.

If you're looking for great Italian food, there is no shortage here in Overbrook. Louis' Restaurant and Pizzeria and Pizzaro's are two excellent, family-friendly restaurants centrally located in the neighbourhood.

The house is just a couple of minutes walk from the beach and the Ottawa River Parkway, a great place to bike, walk, cycle, or cross-country ski along the Ottawa River.
Less than 10 minute walk gets you to popular Richmond Road where you'll find many boutique shopping, cool art galleries, excellent restaurants and European-inspired cafes. Drug stores, supermarkets and everything you need is right there too.

Only a 15 minute drive from parliament hill and the Byward Market, this neighborhood is friendly and quiet to escape the hustle and bustle of downtown. For nature lovers, this area is lucious and green with several parks and biking trails within walking/biking distance.

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.85 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Fantastic location! The Golden Triangle is a small central district known for lively pubs, high-end restaurants, and cafes along its main strip, Elgin Street. The area is also home to several embassies and the Ottawa City Hall complex, with a plaza and pop-up ice-skating rink out front. Leafy Minto Park offers benches and picnic tables, while a paved cycling and walking path lines the Rideau Canal, which borders the neighbourhood.

One of the biggest attractions is the Rideau Canal. Here, you can walk, bike, and skate during the winter. With walking and bike paths and benches, the Canal is a great place to get exercise, and meet other members of the community. In close proximity, you will also find Elgin Street, the National Arts Centre, and the Rideau Centre. You can walk home from the Jazz Festival, Winterlude, or Canada Day festivities. This neighbourhood offers great restaurants and pubs, several parks, and a community centre complete with a pool and tennis courts.

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.50 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Proximity to everything!  The building backs out onto pathways along the river and is a few minutes walk from Ottawa's Famous Rideau canal, Elgin Street bar district, and 25min walk from Parliament hill and the Byward market area.  Main street (4min walk) has a great Saturday market and Ottawa's most famous vegan restaurant (The Green Door).  Also close to Old Ottawa South, The Glebe and Lansdowne Park, three of Ottawa's favorite neighborhoods, for restaurants and shopping.   Not a walker?  No problem, it is beside an LRT station connecting you to all of Ottawa's top sites and there is paid parking at the building or free street parking 100 meters from the building. This is also an ideal location for bikers!

host_about:
I'm Craig, and I live in Ottawa, via Vancouver, Dublin, and Paris and Dijon for a bit. 

I love AirBnB because it helps me feel more immersed in a place I’m visiting. Equally, I hope to offer guests a comfortable stay at my place when I’m away that equals some of the best Airbnb’s I’ve had the pleasure of staying at.

My favourite city in the world is Paris and having lived there makes it a home from home. Dublin will always be home and for me is perfect in so many ways. Ottawa has become the place I love to live. When you'll visit, you'll probably see why.

host_about:
Hola, Hello, Bonjour, Marhaba

As a busy professional I know all about the need of a nice place where one can vacation and/or do business. Our home is clean and I would consider myself a tidy, hardworking and easygoing person.

I made Ottawa my home about a decade ago and have loved the balance this city provides. I have met people from different backgrounds and diverse nationalities ever since I moved here. 

I am a canadian public servant with a fascination to learn new languages and meet new people. I am also latina which is why when you don't find me working at the office I love teaching or taking a Zumba Class.

My favourite things include: traveling, politics, dancing and a good coffee/tea or glass of wine with the people I love!

name: Guesthouse in Ottawa · ★4.61 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
host_about:
Welcome to our cozy home in Ottawa west centretown! This unit is on second floor of the duplex house with completely separated entrance. The unit has two bedrooms, one bath, and kitchen with In-Unit laundry and central air conditioner. Driveway can fit in 3 mid-size SUV. 
Few minutes walking to grocery stores, restaurants, pharmacies and public transit station. 350m away from main street of Chinatown, 500m away from Little Italy. Route 11 & 14 can take you to the Parliament Hill and downtown Ottawa. 550 m to reach westbound 417 highway entrance. 
We are open to monthly rental! Ideal home for newcomers to stay before finding your own place in Ottawa. 2.3km away from Service Canada/Service Ontario/City of Ottawa.
As three boys hockey parents, we know what travel means! This place will make you feel like home. 

欢迎您来到我们渥太华舒适的家,这是一栋两单元独立房子,单独出入口, 每层两室一厅,带独立卫生间,厨房,每套均配有洗衣机和干衣机｡我们离唐人街 350米,意大利街500米,临近超市,饭店,药房和高速公路入口｡公交车非常便利,直达国会山和渥太华市中心｡ 车道能停三辆SUV｡

Our mission is to provide overnight accommodations for business travelers in luxury, furnished apartments and serviced homes worldwide. 
Our standards demand that we select properties meeting our executive standards. 
As a global company, we combine our expertise with the local knowledge of our concierge staff who can assist you with any questions during your stay. Our committed team ensures that your stay is enjoyable, memorable, and stress-free from the time you book to the moment you check out. 
One of the most important goals is guest satisfaction. From booking to checkout, a team of dedicated concierges is present to insure your stay is enjoyable and up to standards.

name: Condo in Ottawa · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Located just a 15 minute walk away from parliament, Byward market and a bunch of restaurants and shops this is the perfect neighbourhood to explore Ottawa
host_about:
Hey, 

I am a 25 year old guy who loves to travel and very new to Airbnb. looking for great experiences where ever I go! 

I currently work for RVezy - Canada's largest growing RV rental marketplace.

name: Guest suite in Ottawa · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1.5 baths
host_about:
Hello, 

We are a young family with kids. 

Sharing our home with people from all over the world has been a unique and rewarding experience. 

We always do our utmost to ensure that you have a positive and memorable stay at our place. We can be reached anytime if you have questions, concerns, etc. 

In order to provide you with the best services and comfort, we carefully go through the place before each check-in.

name: Townhouse in Ottawa · ★4.73 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: Nestled in a quiet residential neighbourhood - you are still very close to downtown Ottawa and all of it's attractions!  Less than a 20 minute drive you can be downtown, enjoying the Rideau Canal or Byward Market, and the beautiful architecture and Parliament Buildings.  Also less than 20 minutes away is the well know St. Laurent Shopping area / mall.   Minutes from the house there are multiple grocery stores, Costco, restaurants & shopping.  Also close by are parks and walking / biking / cross country ski trails including:  Chapman Mills Conservation Area; Pinhey Forest (a beautiful, unique conservation area in the Greenbelt); Hog's Back Park & Falls.  And minutes to Merivale Road Shopping area.
host_about: Hello!  My name is Tina.  My husband is Tj and we have 2 awesome and crazy boys (8 and 6 years old:)),  4 dogs, - cat, sheep, goats and a pig - we love our animals:) ! and also have a love of travel and real estate.  My husband is a contractor and lineman and I am a realtor who was previously teaching at a college / university:)   I love to work along side him and help design and create beautiful spaces and homes that bring joy to those that use them and those that live around them!. We hope you enjoy the spaces we own or help manage!  Our property is the Niagara house - one we spent  6 plus months on renovating - a labour of love... as well as the London house :). I also am very excited to be helping other owners provide their beautiful homes on airbnb for you to be able to enjoy!    We love the hosting aspect, and also enjoy being a guest in many air bnbs and vacation rentals by owner. Enjoy!

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.86 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
This Beautiful Gem one bedroom apartment is situated in the Heart of the Byward Market, which is the trendiest part of the city. Everything you need and want is within walking distance from your door. The National Gallery of Canada, Notre-Dame Cathedral and American Embassy is a beautiful 10min walk down the street. You have access to some of the best restaurants in the city, such as Das Lokal which is only 2mins away. Pili Pili Charcoaled grilled chicken which is a must have is just across the street and Bridgehead coffee shop is right around the corner. Don’t forget to check out the best French Baker which is located on Murray.

If you’re looking for the night life say no more only 5 minutes away located on Clarence, York and George Street. You will also discover an array of patios and many more restaurants too.

Located on York Street you will find fresh fruits and vegetables at the Farmer’s Market as well as Le Moulin De Provence where you will find the famou

name: Guest suite in Ottawa · ★4.94 · Studio · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
This is a mature neighbourhood with old trees, lovely brickwork houses, and established neighbours who take pride in the upkeep of their homes and gardens. It is quiet and peaceful!

In short walking distance from your private suite are multiple parks, grocery stores, restaurants, tim hortons & more.
host_about: Quiet, cat loving host and adventurous traveler!

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.18 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Modern and friendly residential neighborhood, very close to the downtown core. Cafes, shops and a farmers market are all within close walking distance. You'll also find parks, bicycle paths and Westboro Beach!

neighborhood_overview: Several restaurants are less than a 5-minute walk, ranging from eclectic Vietnamese and Mexican/Colombian to McDonald's. The Glebe is know for it's magnificent architecture. Many of Ottawa's former lumber barons, politicians and scions of industry called this part of the nation's capital home.
host_about: I am a licensed Realtor in Ottawa. Together with my wife, Chantal, we look forward to hosting you in one of our luxurious suites.

name: Guest suite in Ottawa · ★5.0 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.91 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
This Beautiful Gem is situated in the Heart of the Byward Market, which is the trendiest part of the city. Everything you need and want is within walking distance from your door. The National Gallery of Canada, Notre-Dame Cathedral and American Embassy is a beautiful 10min walk down the street. You have access to some of the best restaurants in the city, such as Das Lokal which is only 2mins away. Pili Pili Charcoaled grilled chicken which is a must have is just across the street and Bridgehead coffee shop is right around the corner. Don’t forget to check out the best French Baker which is located on Murray.

If you’re looking for the night life say no more only 5 minutes away located on Clarence, York and George Street. You will also discover an array of patios and many more restaurants too.

Located on York Street you will find fresh fruits and vegetables at the Farmer’s Market as well as Le Moulin De Provence where you will find the famous Obama cookie.

name: Guest suite in Ottawa · ★4.98 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
There is a great casual dining restaurant with a bar, and a few fast food establishments within a 2 minute walk, as well as a couple of convenience stores and a gas station. There is your choice of at least 3 grocery stores, all less than a 6 minute drive away and a drug store just down the street.

Mooney's Bay Park & Beach is a short drive away - or a 30 minute walk - on the other side of the river. In addition to a great beach, the park also boasts having one of the largest playgrounds in Canada! You can stop and take a stroll around the popular Hog's Back Falls on your way. From there or Mooney's Bay Park one can access the bike/walking path that follows the Rideau Canal, which is designated as a World Heritage site by UNESCO, all the way downtown. There's also a lovely walking/running trail very close to us.
host_about: I am a retired community/home visit nurse and my husband, Steve, retired after 44 years working in the field of property management. We love to travel! We have stayed in many wonderful Airbnb accommodations and are excited to offer an exceptional Airbnb experience to our guests.

name: Home in Ottawa · ★4.89 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Westboro is a hub of activity all year-long, but particularly during the warm weather months.

Enjoy the soft sand, water activities and spectacular sunsets at Westboro Beach on the Ottawa River.

Over one weekend in August, the Fuse Street Festival turns Richmond Road into a party with live music, culinary experiences and family fun.

During mild weather, the recreational pathways along the Ottawa River are filled with cyclists, pole-walkers, roller-bladers and runners. In the winter, the section between Westboro and the Canadian War Museum near downtown Ottawa becomes the Sir John A. Macdonald Winter Trail, known locally as the SJAM. Cross-country skiers, snowshoers, fat-bikers and walkers all use this groomed snow route. Urban nature at its best!
host_about:
I was born and raised in an island in Azores, Portugal. Moved to Canada in my early 20's and started a new life here. 

Married my soulmate and have 2 grown up daughters. 

I’m fun and easy going and really love meeting new people. My passion has always been cooking and hosting get togethers for family and friends. One of the many reasons I decided to host the Airbnb. Looking forward to meeting you and making your stay here in Ottawa as pleasant as possible.

There is so much to do at Thousand Owls Estate that guests will not want to leave. However should you be looking for other things to do during your stay, the house is conveniently located less than a 30-minute drive to downtown Ottawa and all of the city?s amenities. The communities of Cumberland and Rockland are also only 5 minutes away and offer many great restaurants, shopping, golf courses and other activities for the whole family to enjoy.

At Thousand Owls Estate, you can enjoy a private resort-like experience with only your family and friends and make memories to cherish for a lifetime!
host_about:
We (Erin & Mike Copeland) live in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada with our two young children. We are avid travelers and have visited many beautiful places around the world. When Covid hit and we were not able to travel, we looked to find a beautiful vacation spot closer to home where we could still enjoy quality time with family and friends while making long-lasting memories. 

Welcome to Thousand Owls Estate - your own private resort oasis in Ottawa! This home sits on a private 10-acre property and boasts over 5,000 square feet of living space, featuring a heated indoor heated pool, a hot tub, a sauna, a solarium, a movie theatre room, a home gym, and three separate games rooms featuring ping-pong, air hockey, pool tables, a poker table, a dart board, video games, board games and much more. These amenities can all be enjoyed year-round making Thousand Owls Estate the perfect vacation spot for any season.

name: Condo in Ottawa · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Our condo is located in one of the city’s most vibrant areas! You’ll be steps away from parks and ponds, walking and biking paths along the canal that whisk you down to parliament or up to Hog’s Back Falls. Rent Stand Up Paddle boards, canoes, or kayaks a short walk away at Dow’s Lake; have a picnic in the Arboretum or stroll through the tulip festival across from the lake in spring. Skate on the world’s longest rink right in your own backyard! Don’t feel like cooking? You’re a 5 minute walk to several well- known restaurants all within Lansdowne, where you’ll see the Aberdeen Pavilion, home to the Sunday farmers’ market pretty much year round. Wander down Bank Street to discover quaint boutique shopping, grocery stores, cafes, pubs, and many more restaurants of various cuisine types. There’s always something to do in the Glebe!
host_about: I'm a retired teacher who enjoys  entertaining, traveling and getting outdoors. My husband and I love to cycle the Ottawa river paths, hike in the Gatineau hills near our home, and paddle the back country lakes of Ontario. We also enjoy the many local pubs and restaurants, art galleries, concerts and other live events in our vibrant city.

name: Cottage in Ottawa · ★4.75 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1 bath
Campsite in Ottawa · ★5.0 · Half-bath
neighborhood_overview:
Camping at the 103 Acre woods is part of the Marlborough Forest. It has groomed pathways in the meadow and rustic pathways through the woods for your hiking pleasure. If you are interested in backwoods camping, it's easy to do here, park your car in the driveway, grab your gear, and head to the back forty!

I only list 2 sites for camping so you will have plenty of space and privacy from any other campers. Lots of space to spread out and have your privacy. If you want complete privacy, reserve both sites! (The Cedars & 103 Paces)

If you are staying in an RV, you can park in the driveway and still access all the other parts of the property. Tent campers can select anywhere they want to pitch a tent and enjoy the beauty of the 103 Acre woods. Depending on where you choose to camp, you might be able to drive right up to your site.

name: Campsite in Ottawa · ★5.0 · Half-bath
neighborhood_overview:
Camping at the 103 Acre woods is part of the Marlborough Forest. It has groomed pathways in the meadow and rustic pathways through the woods for your hiking pleasure. If you are interested in backwoods camping, it's easy to do here, park your car in the driveway, grab your gear, and head to the back forty!

I only list 2 sites for camping so you will have plenty of space and privacy from any other campers. Lots of space to spread out and have your privacy. If you want complete privacy, reserve both sites! (The Cedars & 103 Paces)

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.94 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The Glebe has a strong community association which, in addition to running a large community centre, lobbies the local government on issues such as traffic calming and neighbourhood development. The Glebe has a community newspaper, Glebe Report, that has been published independently since 1973.

The Glebe is mostly populated by families; the area has many children, and consequently its social services are oriented towards youth. The Glebe lies in the federal riding of Ottawa Centre, and the same provincial electoral district.

The stretch of Bank Street that runs through the Glebe is one of Ottawa's premier shopping areas, with many small stores and restaurants offering a wide variety of services. Much of the rest of the Glebe consists of detached homes, many of them constructed in the early decades of the 20th century. Some of these homes are owner-occupied family residences, while others have been subdivided into multiple rental apartments.

The Glebe is

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.43 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Sandy Hill -
Sandy Hill is a neighbourhood in Ottawa, located just east of downtown. The neighbourhood is bordered on the west by the Rideau Canal and on the east by the Rideau River. To the north it stretches to Rideau Street and the Byward Market area while to the south it is bordered by the Queensway highway and Nicholas Street. It is home to a number of embassies, residences and parks. Le cordon bleu operates its Canadian school there, at the opposite end of Sandy Hill from the University of Ottawa.

Byward Market -
Join some friends for brunch, lunch or dinner, and then hit the shops for the highest quality food products, fashions and cutting edge trends. See and be seen until the wee hours at one of our hip nightspots. Morning, noon and night the ByWard Market has something just for you. Established by Lt-Col. John By in 1826, the ByWard Market is one of Canada's oldest and largest public markets. The legendary builder of the Rideau Canal, Colonel By himself

Enjoy Hintonburg's many amenities including boutique shops, fantastic dining and some of Ottawa's best coffee and bakery shops. In addition, there are many grocery options and other essential services (pharmacy, post office, banks, etc). The Ottawa Hospital Civic Campus is just steps away, making Hintonburg an excellent option for visiting medical professionals working at the hospital.

host_about: Hello! My name is Rebecca and I work at the local university and my partner Adam is a local high school teacher. After having had such a great experience staying with different AirB&B hosts, we are excited to start hosting our own home and welcoming guests to Ottawa.  We have been living in Ottawa for over 15 years and are happy to answer any questions you may have about what to do during your stay!

name: Guest suite in Ottawa · ★4.93 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Check out our Guidebook for suggestions on things to see and do!

The Airbnb is perfectly situated to enjoy Ottawa and the surrounding area and provides immediate access to the uniqueness of the adjacent neighbourhoods.

Walk south on Preston Street and enjoy the little cafés, shops, and restaurants. At the south end of Preston Street is Dow's Lake and Canada's Arboretum, a beautiful place to enjoy a picnic (if you like deli sandwiches we recommend stopping by Di Rienzo's along the way).

Walk east on Somerset Street to take in Chinatown and its endless options for pho or west on Somerset Street to explore the hip and trendy Hintonburg neighbourhood.

Head north towards the Ottawa River to take in Ottawa's amazing network of pathways. If you enjoy getting outside, we highly suggest walking along the Trans Canada Trail that follows the Ottawa River (accessible from the Trillium Pathway). If you have any questions about the path network, just as
host_about:
Hi, we're Sue & Marsh.
We are a friendly couple who love to travel. We have traveled the world from Thailand, Vietnam, Colombia, New Zealand, Australia, Japan, France to Italy and more. We still have much to see and do. We both love the outdoors. We spend our time cycling, running, hiking, paddle boarding and in the winter, skiing. Marsh has a green thumb and is a garden whisperer. I’m more of a foodie! Marsh is an engineer by day, and I work in business. We are easy-going people that like discovering new things and hanging out with our dog Rambo.

name: Home in Ottawa · ★4.94 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
You are five blocks from The Byward Market, where you will find every amenity you need: small quaint grocery shops, as well as restaurants, bars, the Rideau Shopping Centre, the public library, public swimming pool and gym, the Bytowne Cinema, etc. There is a tennis court one street away, and a skating rink in the winter.

There are several parks to stroll to like the Confederation Park behind the Fairmount Hotel, or the Rideau locks (which is an UN Heritage site), with its gorgeous path along the Ottawa River.

name: Home in Ottawa · ★4.65 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1.5 shared baths
neighborhood_overview: It is the flowering season in May. This house is located in the middle of two picturesque rivers. 550 meters to the east is the adawa crossing bridge across the rideau river. Walking, listening to the singing of the river, the solo singing of the birds, the heart is suddenly calm and serene. And 950 meters to the west from the house is corktown footbridgeh across the rideau canal. You can also walk or ride on the path on both sides of the river to enjoy the city's style and natural landscape. From May to mid-August, this is located on the campus of the University of Ottawa The community is very quiet, the students have already left the school for the holiday, and the surrounding streets are suddenly free from the hustle and bustle of the past.
host_about:
Hello, I'd like to give the best service for all of guests coming into our place. We provide snacks and water, and we'll make sure your room is cozy annd comfortable. 
best regards for all of you
I would like to share my experience in my life and music.

name: Villa in Gatineau · ★4.74 · 4 bedrooms · 8 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
On the edge of the ByWard Market, The Shaw Centre , Rideue Centre , Parliment Hill, University of Ottawa and all the attractions, The Condo benefits from an ideal LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION

The extravagant redevelopment of Rideau Centre, along with ByWard Market’s unique array of specialty shops and fashion boutiques makes for a world class shopping experience.

Furthermore, a few steps away from your lobby, is the center of the city’s thriving creative scene, with exhibitions from the top local and world-renowned artists showcased right in your neighbourhood.

Quaint cafes and patisseries give ByWard Market an old time charm, while the city’s top-rated fine dining establishments and chic cocktail lounges provide the luxe contemporary feel of urban life. Endless culinary variety is yours as every type of cuisine offers up a new cultural experience.
host_about: World traveler. Always exploring different city

name: Townhouse in Ottawa · ★4.97 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview:
Lindenlea/New Edinburgh/Beechwood : As one of the oldest residential neighbourhood of Ottawa, the area is a sweet combination of a safe, quiet, yet lively and viable area. The neighborhood is connected to downtown Ottawa and Byward market with a 20-min walk or a short bus ride. It is also close to Montfort Hospital and other amenities around St.Laurent Boulvard.

Beechwood Avenue features small shops, local pubs, cafes, bakeries, specialty food stores, book stores, as well as basic amenities such as grocery store, dry cleaner, post office and pharmacies etc. In a ten minute walking distance in the neighbourhood, you can find beautiful and well maintained parks such as Stanley Park and Rockliffe Rockeries, Rideau Hall (Governor General's residence and its beautiful garden), walking and cycling paths, skate rinks, and tree lined old streets. There is a Farmer's market at Stanley Park in Spring and Summer on Saturdays.

It's a 5 minute drive (25 minute walk or 10 min bus ride) to the Byward market and just a 15 minute drive to Gatineau Park. There are many bike paths in the area so you can easily get where you need to go. Stanley Park is a real gift to families with kids, especially in the winter when the skating rink is set up. In warmer months, you can walk or bike along the river, play tennis, play frisbee or even go for a kayak ride in the river.

name: Guest suite in Ottawa · ★4.94 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Any direction you walk leads to interesting sites. Walk or cycle South along the picturesque historic Rideau Canal to reach Ottawa Lansdowne Park where you can attend professional sporting events, take in a movie or enjoy shopping, coffee and restaurants; in the adjacent Glebe neighborhood you will find a strip of boutiques. Further along the canal you will reach Carleton University and the Hogs Back Lock Station set in beautiful natural surroundings. In the opposite direction on Elgin Street, you will come upon many restaurants, the Museum of Nature, the Ottawa Courthouse, the National Arts Centre, the National War Memorial monument, the Parliament Buildings, and adjacent Supreme Court.  East from this location you will find the ByWard Market, National Gallery and many more site seeing, shopping, and eating opportunities.

name: Condo in Ottawa · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
New Edinburgh is a neighbourhood in Rideau-Rockcliffe Ward, in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada. It is located to the northeast of the downtown core. It is bordered on the west by the Rideau River, to the north by the Ottawa River, to the south by Beechwood Avenue, and on the east by Springfield Road and the former Rockcliffe Park village limits.[1]

The area is an older, affluent neighbourhood. The Governor General of Canada's large residence and grounds are located in New Edinburgh, as is 24 Sussex Drive, official residence of the Prime Minister of Canada.

The neighbourhood is home to several embassies and consulates, including those of Spain, South Africa, France, India, Vietnam, and Slovakia. Civil servants (in particular, employees of the nearby Global Affairs Canada) compose a fair portion of the population. Like Rockcliffe Park, the neighbourhood is largely English-speaking, in comparison to the French-speaking district of Vanier to the south.

neighborhood_overview:
Carson Grove - Carson Meadows is a residential neighbourhood located in the east end of Ottawa, Canada. It is a relatively quiet and peaceful community, consisting mainly of single-family homes and townhouses.

The neighbourhood is bordered by St. Laurent Boulevard to the west, the Aviation Parkway to the east, Ogilvie Road to the north, and the Queensway to the south. It is situated in close proximity to several amenities, including shopping centers, restaurants, parks, and schools.

Carson Grove - Carson Meadows is also well-connected to public transportation, with several bus routes running through the area, providing easy access to other parts of the city. It is a diverse neighbourhood with a mix of residents from different cultural backgrounds. Overall, Carson Grove - Carson Meadows is a family-friendly neighbourhood that offers a comfortable and convenient lifestyle.

Hi there,

My name is George and I am from Ottawa, Ontario. :) I am a recent engineering grad that loves to travel and explore new places. I have a stayed at a number of exquisite and modern Airbnb's in the past, that I decided to join the community with my own listing, right here in the Nation's Capital. 


Born and raised here in Ottawa, I know the city inside and out and will be more than glad to answer any of your questions. I recommend the following attractions for first time visitors in the city:


1.  Visit Parliament Hill 
2. Skate on the Canal Rideau during the winter 
3.  Visit the Museum of Nature and  the Canadian War Museum
4. Take a stroll and stop by for a bite to eat in the Byward Market
5. Visit Gatineau Park


Excited to be able to host you whether you're a new traveller to my Airbnb or a returning guest. :)

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.90 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Located in the heart of our Nation’s capital is Centretown Ottawa which includes downtown Ottawa. From beautifully restored Victorian homes on streets canopied with mature trees to high and low-rise condos, there is something for everyone living in Centretown Ottawa.

Living in Centretown Ottawa means living right in the middle of everything: shopping, nightlife, a variety of dining establishments, and tourist attractions. You will love walking along the lovely Rideau Canal to the historic Parliament buildings, popping over to the cafes in Byward Market, shopping at the newly-renovated Rideau Centre, and seeing the many embassies that call Centretown home.

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.78 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
Boutique hotel in Ottawa · ★4.80 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview:
Ideally located in the heart of downtown Ottawa - one night is not enough to live the dream – not when you have direct access to the historic pedestrian Sparks Street, and the vibrant Byward Market, which features a myriad of restaurants, and locally owned shops - and just steps away exquisite shopping in the Rideau Shopping Centre. Guests can ride the elevator to our Skylounge where there are epic shots of Parliament Hill (located just a block away) & the beautiful Gatineau Hills.

Walk to inspiring places including the Rideau Canal, & the National Gallery of Canada, or see a show at the National Arts Centre. You can catch a light rail train from Parliament Station and explore the rest of the city with ease.

It’s all waiting for you at reStays Ottawa.

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.84 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
We are in the middle of a quiet street which coincidentally links up to all that Westboro has to offer.

A few steps to the South is Ottawa’s premier pedestrian main street with the best of new restaurants, pubs, specialty coffee and shopping as well as MEC and the adventure outfitting retail cluster that accompanies it. Every convenience is also there in the way of pharmacy, post office, dry cleaning, health food stores, etc. Yoga studios abound and several churches are close. The Maplelawn heritage garden and historic manor house (with restaurant - best steaks in town) are also around the corner. The Byron linear park offers a fine walk about and is filled with the tastes and smiles of the outdoor Westboro food and farmers market every Saturday May through October.

A few steps to the North and you come across the panoramic Ottawa river. Westboro beach is the best swimming spot in town, kayaks and canoes lay about with volleyball and movie nights upon occas
host_about: Working Professional.  Embrace life - there is so much to explore and enjoy! Happy to make recommendations of how to max out your stay in Ottawa! Just ask!

neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to Riverside South
Home to one of Ottawa’s most desired communities.

Situated less than 25 minutes drive to anywhere in Ottawa, along the stunning eastern shores of the Rideau River is the community of Riverside South. Directly across the river banks is the much larger community of Barrhaven, which is easily accessible for Riverside South residents via the conjoining Vimy Memorial Bridge that crosses the Rideau River. Riverside South is full of nature trails, community parks, shops, dining and services.

Free tennis courts are available at Summerhill Park which is 4 minutes driveway.

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.57 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Cumberland is a historic neighborhood known for its picturesque setting and charming small-town feel. Here are some highlights about the neighborhood:

Cumberland Village is a designated heritage district, offering a unique glimpse into the region's rich history.
The neighborhood features larger lots surrounded by mature trees and forests, providing a serene and peaceful environment for residents and visitors alike.
Cumberland offers a variety of outdoor activities, including hiking, fishing, and boating, with easy access to the Ottawa River and nearby parks.
The nearby Cumberland Heritage Village Museum offers a fascinating look at the region's history and is a popular destination for tourists and locals alike.
While Cumberland is a small town, it is located just a short drive away from the suburban conveniences of Orleans, making it easy to access services and amenities.
The neighborhood is home to a tight-knit community of families and professional
host_about: The region boasts unique natural beauty, located along the Ottawa River, with rolling hills and mature forests. Attractions include the Cumberland Heritage Village Museum, a vibrant community-run operating from June to October, plus a community centre and rink

name: Home in Ottawa · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Westboro is a hub of activity all year-long, but particularly during the warm weather months.

Enjoy the soft sand, water activities and spectacular sunsets at Westboro Beach on the Ottawa River.

In spring, Westboro Village welcomes all to join in a celebration of retailers during Shop the Village. All summer long, people fill the patios along the main street and shop at the Ottawa Farmers Market on Saturdays at Byron Linear Park. As the leaves change colour in the fall, look out for ghosts, spiders, skulls and more during the annual Wickedly Westboro Scavenger Hunt.

During mild weather, the recreational pathways along the Ottawa River are filled with cyclists, pole-walkers, roller-bladers and runners. In the winter, the section between Westboro and the Canadian War Museum near downtown Ottawa becomes the Kichi Sibi Winter Trail. Cross-country skiers, snowshoers, fat-bikers and walkers all use this groomed snow route. Urban nature at its best!
host_about:
I am experienced Super Host on Air Bnb.

An Interior Designer by profession.
I have a passion for the arts, music , fashion and food.

The spaces My wife ( Julianne) and I create, have a long history to them.
And as such, we take immense pride in their story.

We both love travelling and try to do so when we can get a few moments to breathe between our busy work schedules. That being said, we love to entertain, dine out and experience new things. 

We look forward to Hosting you!

host_about:
My husband Emmanuel and I have always enjoyed hosting guests over the years and love the opportunity Airbnb allows us to host our homes to travellers and local staycationers. 

We want to cater our homes to couples, families and individuals looking for a nice getaway home that is removed from the hustle and bustle of the inner cities but yet close to all amenities.

As avid travelers ourselves, we know how important it is to have all that you need at your disposal when in a new environment. So, we’ve packed our homes with all the right essentials so that you can feel right at home. And if anything comes up, you can always reach out and we will be quick to respond and resolve any issues or concerns.

name: Guesthouse in Ottawa · ★4.93 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: The Golden Triangle neighbourhood is vibrant and full of life. From restaurants, boutique shopping, the Rideau Canal, (skating in winter, paddling or canoeing in the summer) bike paths, steps from the Museum of Nature, and steps away from the Glebe neighbourhood, Centretown and the Market area of Ottawa.  During the day, this area is full of peole walking, running, biking though  and a mix of old homes, apartments, condos, while at night, people seek out the nightlife along Elgin Street with it's wide-ranging cuisine, pubs and clubs.  The perfect spot for families, (a fab park around the corner) as well as those seeking a hub to then go explore the city and beyond!
host_about:
We are Judith & Pamela!  We met years ago as neighbours working on volunteer projects around education and also environmental issues in our community.  We became good friends along the way.  

With our nests emptying, we decided to open a Bed and Breakfast, together.  Having worked with international clientele throughout our careers, hosting guests from out of town fits with our interests and lifestyle.  We have lots of plans to make our home and guest spaces a showcase for sustainable living. We are hoping our guests give us suggestions while they are with us!

Judith currently works as a supply teacher in the OCDSBoard. She also runs a house painting business, and a myriad of other smaller jobs. Pamela taught international teachers how to teach English as a second or foreign language;  now she works from home, teaching online and welcoming guests.  

The two of us will live in the apartment on the main level. You'll see us  in and out of the apartment during the day.

Dive into the heart of serenity as you step into Constance Bay, a charming enclave nestled by the gentle Ottawa River. Our serene neighborhood extends a warm embrace to those seeking refuge in nature’s lap, away from the hustle of city life. Here, the day begins with a melodious symphony of birds at dawn and ends with the sky painting itself in hues of twilight reflected on calm waters.

Constance Bay isn’t just a stay; it’s an experience of returning to nature. Our local beach is a haven of tranquility where each wave plays along with the soft sands. It’s a perfect spot for long, reflective strolls, playful family days under the sun, or a serene reading spot with the rhythm of waves as your companion. For the trail-lovers, verdant pathways await to be explored, each turning revealing the simplistic elegance and wonder of woodland realms.

The spirit of community runs deep in Constance Bay's veins. Local diners serve a palette of homely flavors, encapsulating the es

Hi there,

I’m a young professional who has worked in the travel and entertainment industry for 10+ years. I’ve worked in Canada, Brazil, and the Philippines and I speak both French and English. name: Guesthouse in Ottawa · ★4.93 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
neighborhood_overview: The Golden Triangle neighbourhood is vibrant and full of life. From restaurants, boutique shopping, the Rideau Canal, (skating in winter, paddling or canoeing in the summer) bike paths, steps from the Museum of Nature, and steps away from the Glebe neighbourhood, Centretown and the Market area of Ottawa.  During the day, this area is full of peole walking, running, biking though  and a mix of old homes, apartments, condos, while at night, people seek out the nightlife along Elgin Street with it's wide-ranging cuisine, pubs and clubs.  The perfect spot for families, (a fab park around the corner) as well as those seeking a hub to then go explore the city and beyond!
host_about:
We are Judith & Pamela!  We met years ago as neighbours working on volunteer projects around education and also environmental issues in our community.  We became good friends along the way.  

With our nests emptying, we decided to open a Bed and Breakfast, together.  Having worked with international clientele throughout our careers, hosting guests from out of town fits with our interests and lifestyle.  We have lots of plans to make our home and guest spaces a showcase for sustainable living. We are hoping our guests give us suggestions while they are with us!

Judith currently works as a supply teacher in the OCDSBoard. She also runs a house painting business, and a myriad of other smaller jobs. Pamela taught international teachers how to teach English as a second or foreign language;  now she works from home, teaching online and welcoming guests.  

The two of us will live in the apartment on the main level. You'll see us  in and out of the apartment during the day.

name: Home in Ottawa · ★5.0 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
You are in the heart of the Glebe, an established centuries-old area of Ottawa. A very hip neighbourhood lined by beautiful Victorian-style homes with diverse amenities including boutiques, bakeries, grocers, banks, pharmacies, specialty cafés, cinemas, fine dining, casual dining, and pubs. You are a five-minute walk to the scenic Rideau Canal, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, where you can bike/walk/run along tree-lined paths or ice-skate in the winter along the longest skating canal in the world.

We have easy access to public transit on OC-Transpo (a two-minute walk) that will take you to Parliament Hill in ten minutes. The Lansdowne development (a two-minute walk) has brought a new vibe to our neighbourhood with trendy restaurants, green space with a skatepark, play structures, a WholeFoods grocery store and a modern theatre built around the Lansdowne stadium which is home to the Ottawa Red Blacks (CFL), Atlético Ottawa (CPL) and the Ottawa Sixty Sevens (AHL). Our location

name: Townhouse in Ottawa · ★4.75 · 2 bedrooms · 4 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview: Barrhaven is a suburb of Ottawa, Ontario, Canada. It is located about 17 km (11 mi) southwest of the city's downtown core.  South of this is the area known as Longfields, which stretches south to Strandherd and east to Woodroffe Avenue. Sandwiched between the railway tracks, Jockvale Road, Greenbank and Strandherd is the neighbourhood of Barrhaven on the Green. East of Woodroffe, next to the Rideau River, is the neighbourhood of Davidson Heights. South of Strandherd and east of Greenbank is a new community known as Chapman Mills.

name: Home in Ottawa · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 3 baths

Condo in Ottawa · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 private bath
neighborhood_overview: The neighbors are very quiet, mostly elders, and friendly! The neighborhood is very well situated with several amenities a 3-4 mins walk from the building - groceries, bank, coffee shop, etc . There is a beautiful forested path for walking, running, biking etc just next to the building. It goes right to Ottawa River with great views.
host_about:
Hi AirBnBers, 

So a little about me:
I've been living in Toronto for the past 7 years and don't plan on moving elsewhere for a long time.  I like to have family closeby... :)  BUT i'm a big traveller and I absolutely love to experience new cultures, landscapes, and people so i travel on average once a year. I've travelled mostly in the Latin American region and in the Middle East and can't wait to see more of the world.  Some of my favourite destinations: La Paz, Bolivia (I have never danced like I did that night!!!) and Cappadocia, Turkey (you gotta see it to believe it!).   When I travel, I am all about meeting locals.  I want to see a place through the eyes of the people that live there.  
That's why I love the concept of AirBnB - what's better than staying in an actual residence rather than a hotel? And better yet, having a chance to meet an airBnB host and learn about their city through their eyes and based on their experiences.  

As for my life in Toronto - I am currently doing my grad studies in Environmental Studies.  I am super passionate about the role of clean energy and energy efficiency in community economic development - particularly in lower income communities. I've been doing environmental and social justice work for many years and imagine I will be for most my life. 

What else? I'm an avid reader - I just finished the Millennium Trilogy by Stiegg Larson (think Girl with the Dragon Tatoo) - if you're into mystery/crime novels I would highly recommend this series! 

I like to cook lots - i've been trying to master some Persian dishes lately to make my mom proud, and I like to do active things - yoga, long walks, aerobics, etc.  Anything to counterbalance all those hours i'm forced to spend in front of a computer! 

If you were to host me, you'd find that I like a balance of doing things solo and also making my way around the city with some company.  I would like to meet the airbnb host I stay with, but I understand if they don't have much time to spend with their guests.  Essentially I adapt my travelling style based on the context.  I have travelled alone, in groups, in pairs, and i've stayed at hostels, with host families,  and bed and breakfasts.  Each experience is different, each host is different, so I think it's important to adapt as a traveller.  All I'm looking for is a clean place, and a friendly host I am depend on if there area any problems.  I am super independent and responsible so I promise to take good care of your place :)

name: Home in Ottawa · ★4.96 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Our house is in the Forbes neighborhood, which is a safe, friendly, and quiet community. There is a well-known private school St-Laurent Academy on the corner of the street, and a kid street playground next to it, which is very friendly to children. A five-minute walk from the neighborhood will take you to the Aviation pathway, it is a Scenic trail and get close to nature in the heart of the city!

Also, living here is very convenient for you. It is close to a shopping plaza, just 5 minutes’ walk. You could find restaurants and shops, e.g., 24 hours MacDonald’s, Tim Horton’s, Swiss Chalet, Pizza Hut, Independent, Farm Boy, Shoppers Drug mart, Dollarama, Beer Store, Shawarma, Vietnamese restaurant, TD Canada Trust, RBC, Desjardins, etc.
host_about:
My name is Kailin, I grew up in China. I used to be the CEO of a media start up company in China, and tired of the hustle and bustle of big city life. I followed my husband Qingwei to Ottawa, Canada and fell in love with the slow living lifestyle here.

Currently, Qingwei is a software engineer, and I am a stay-at-home mom and housing manager, and welcome you from all over the world is my most important job at the moment.


I am sharing with you a set of residences that I like very much. When I saw it at first glance, I couldn't help but want to own it. It is a house built in the 1950s. After several renovations, it became a place with exquisite and casual style. It has its own style and soul.

Here, you not only enjoy the convenience of the urban life circle, but also be completely close to nature! Sitting under the shade of the trees in the sun room reading a book and drinking coffee is my favorite thing to do every day. Whether you're on a business trip, busy with work, or someone who enjoys traveling, you'll love the relaxation here! This home will blow your tiredness away!

Everyone who has lived in the house will say it's great! Hope you all love it as much as I do!

name: Guest suite in Ottawa · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
Home in Ottawa · ★4.67 · 3 bedrooms · 5 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Great family neighborhood, close to schools and amenities. The atmosphere there is very welcoming, and people of all ages and lifestyles can feel at home there. Orleans is a new part of the city, in that it only became part of Ottawa in 2001. It's located just off of the Ottawa River, just a few miles east of the downtown core.

There are a number of schools there, and the population continues to rise. The shopping center just off the Queensway is one of the most central and significant landmarks in the Orleans area, and part of what make it such a good place for singles, families, and retirees. Lots of restaurants and shopping in the area.

neighborhood_overview:
Lindenlea/New Edinburgh/Beechwood : As one of the oldest residential neighbourhood of Ottawa, the area is a sweet combination of a safe, quiet, yet lively and viable area. The neighborhood is connected to downtown Ottawa and Byward market with a 20-min walk or a short bus ride. It is also close to Montfort Hospital and other amenities around St.Laurent Boulvard.

Beechwood Avenue features small shops, local pubs, cafes, bakeries, specialty food stores, book stores, as well as basic amenities such as grocery store, dry cleaner, post office and pharmacies etc. In a ten minute walking distance in the neighbourhood, you can find beautiful and well maintained parks such as Stanley Park and Rockliffe Rockeries, Rideau Hall (Governor General's residence and its beautiful garden), walking and cycling paths, skate rinks, and tree lined old streets. There is a Farmer's market at Stanley Park in Spring and Summer on Saturdays.

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★3.80 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is steps away from the trendy Little Italy district, and a short walking distance to all major downtown attractions as well as Ottawa's finest restaurants, coffee shops, museums, and art galleries.

Nearby attractions include Parliament Hill, Rideau Center, Byward Market, Rideau Canal, Little Italy, China Town, all of the Museums (Canadian War Museum, National Gallery, Canadian Museum of Nature, Canadian Museum of Science and Technology, Canadian Museum of History, and the Canadian Museum of Space and Aviation), Commissioner's Park, Dows Lake Pavillion, several hiking trails, the waterway (popular for kayaking), and Gatineau.

There's also Nordique spa, which is a 20-minute drive in Chelsea, Quebec. It is absolutely beautiful with thermal baths and spas. I'd highly recommend it if you're able to go!
host_about:
We are thrilled to welcome guests from around the world to share our home and our love of the surrounding area.  We understand how important a successful vacation is; the feelings you get like you're ready to take on the world again. You get to relax with family and friends and take a break from your usual routines, while promoting togetherness and creating shared memories of times spent together. 

We have a passion for creating an inviting space and comfortable atmosphere. We look forward to sharing it with you!

name: Townhouse in Ottawa · ★4.97 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview: The unit is located on a quiet street that is a five-minute walk from the main street of Little Italy, with its many great restaurants and cafes to explore. For those that enjoy walking or biking, the unit is also close to park area around Dow’s Lake with access to bike trails around the Rideau canal that can take you around the city. The unit is centrally located which makes it an ideal place from which to explore other trendy neighbourhoods in Ottawa like the Glebe, Hintonburg, China Town, and Centre town. For longer term guests, the central location of the unit is appreciated for its proximity to amenities, public transportation, and access to the airport (15 mins), the Civic Hospital (5 mins), the Carleton University (5 mins), Ottawa University (15 mins), and the Byward market (15 mins).

host_about:
Hey ya! My name is Hussein. I’m just a guy who likes to create cool stuff.  I love to travel and discover new places and different cultures. I've stayed in Airbnb's all over the world and always get inspiration from the places I visit. A home can say a lot about a person without even having to meet in person. Neatness and cleanliness is a must, call it OCD if you like, I call it perfectionism.

My favourite things in the world are trees and the wood they produce, photography and of course food. I especially love the outdoors and camping. Oh, and I love coffee!

My property, which I have furnished and decorated with style, is situated in a fantastic Ottawa neighbourhood. As a host, I can't wait to show fellow travellers the same great hospitality I have received all around the globe.

name: Townhouse in Ottawa · ★4.96 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Top Rated Attractions

Ottawa is an inspiring metropolis that straddles the border between Ontario and Quebec. No matter the season, the historical landmarks, breath-taking natural beauty, and countless selection of entertainment offerings will provide you memories that will last a lifetime!

*Outdoor Recreation*
Ready to explore the great outdoors? You’re in luck! There are dozens of natural attractions for you to explore, so you’ll surely satisfy you thirst for adventure. There’s Rideau Canal - a UNESCO world heritage site - consisting of a 7.8 km canal that that turns into the worlds largest ice skating rink in the winter, or the setting for a leisurely walk during the summer. If you want to disconnect from the city life and get in touch with mother nature, the Dominion Arboretum is the place to be! Here you will be fascinated by 86 acres of blossoming garden grounds – with over 1,700 species of plant life to indulge in. Plus, with over 20 parks found within

name: Guest suite in Ottawa · ★4.59 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Blackburn Hamlet has rural areas and several older and newer settlement areas. The lands form part of Ottawa's "Greenbelt" and provide Blackburn Hamlet residents and visitors with over 250 km of hiking and cross-country skiing trails.

Ottawa is Canada’s capital, east of southern Ontario, near Montréal and the U.S. border. Sitting on the Ottawa River, it has at its centre Parliament Hill, with grand Victorian architecture and museums such as the National Gallery of Canada, with noted collections of indigenous and other Canadian art. The park-lined Rideau Canal is filled with boats in summer and ice skaters in winter.

Traditionally the ByWard Market (in Lower Town), Parliament Hill and the Golden Triangle (both in Centretown – Downtown) have been the focal points of the cultural scenes in Ottawa. Modern thoroughfares such as Wellington Street, Rideau Street, Sussex Drive, Elgin Street, Bank Street, Somerset Street, Preston Street, Richmond Road in Westboro, and Spar

Neighbourhood description
Activities and entertainment is easily accessible within a few minutes walk.

**Wondering about safety of the neighbourhood?
The building is very safe and has a 24hr security guard like a high end luxury hotel. The building is located right in the heart of downtown and it is a very touristy area. It is recommended to always exercise adequate discretion like when travelling downtown in any metropolitan city. According to Statistics Canada, Ottawa has one of the lowest crime rates in Canada for a metropolitan area. Ottawa crime rates are well below Montreal, Toronto, Vancouver, Edmonton, Guelph, Kingston, St. John, and many others.

name: Home in Ottawa · ★4.90 · 3 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Arty Hintonburg's shopping and dining scene is centered on the cool boutiques, bistros, vegan cafes and coffee shops of Wellington Street West. At night, locals head to trendy supper clubs and brewpubs. The Great Canadian Theatre Company stages edgy work by local playwrights, while small galleries, studios and street murals reflect the creative atmosphere. Laroche Park hosts fairs and art events.

In its April 2007 issue, enRoute magazine named Hintonburg one of the top ten emerging neighbourhoods in Canada
host_about:
Hi there! My name is Kal, and I’ve been living here in the Ottawa-Gatineau region for over 20 years. I'm someone that many say that think out the box. I like exploring and doing things differently.

I speak English and French fluently.

I enjoy meeting new people and familiarizing myself with other cultures. I’m enthusiastic about anything new, l like playing sports and do various activities like, building furniture, designing floor plans, and any type of work that requires any physical activity. I’m obsessed with traveling – in addition to having traveled all over the US, I’ve visited over twenty countries in total in Asia, Africa, Latin America and Europe. 

Looking forward to meeting you! I’m confident your your stay will be comfortable and you'll enjoy this awesome centrally located neighbourhood in the city to the fullest! 

Feel free to reach out to me if you have any questions regarding my listing.

name: Bed and breakfast in Ottawa · ★4.85 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 2 shared baths
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is a mix of seniors, and young families. The odd student rental house here and there but mostly mature and friendly people. There are some really nice houses on each street and old unique ones side by side. All lots are double sized so each yard is large and private from neighbors,

anything is accessible by walking or bike near here. Bus stops are also very close by if you need to access the city. If your good at navigating bike trails, you might actually get around some places quicker than driving depending on the time of day and location! We also have some beautiful bike trails in this part of the city that connect everywhere from Kanata to Orleans and in between.

Originally the homes used to be cottages same as Britannia. Most of the cottages were demolished and changed into houses. The large lots with big mature trees keeps the cottage vibes and is a real treat to have the convenience and rivers nearby.
host_about: Born and raised in Ottawa!
host_neighbourhood: Braemar Park - Bel Air Heights - Copeland Park
property_type: Private room in bed and breakfast

Pubs, cafes and gift shops line Elgin Street.

host_about:
Hi, I'm Remy!

I am a full-time legal/tech analyst who enjoys living in a city with a blossoming music scene. I have been lucky enough to travel to some amazing places and blessed for having opportunity to meet with some wonderful people. 

As this quote says: "A place is only as good as the people you know in it. It's the people that make the place." by  Pittacus Lore. The people in a place bring it to life, and their personalities, values, and actions shape the culture and atmosphere of that location.

Now I slowed down my travels,  and instead developed a passion for being a host. I find great joy in meeting individuals from diverse backgrounds and exchanging stories with them.

I am open and accepting towards all individuals, regardless of where they are in their personal journey. Please don't hesitate to reach out to me if you have any inquiries or concerns regarding my listing.

----
As experienced hosts and travelers, we recognize that guests have varying preferences when it comes to attention and interaction. Some may desire a lot of engagement while others prefer to simply receive the key and have privacy. We put in a lot of effort to ensure that your stay is hassle-free and considerate of your preferences.

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · 2 bedrooms · 1 bed · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Golden Triangle

The Golden Triangle is a small central district known for lively pubs, high-end restaurants, and cafes along its main strip, Elgin Street. The area is also home to several embassies and the Ottawa City Hall complex, with a plaza and pop-up ice-skating rink out front. Leafy Minto Park offers benches and picnic tables, while a paved cycling and walking path lines the Rideau Canal, which borders the neighbourhood.

One of the biggest attractions is the Rideau Canal. Here, you can walk, bike, and skate during the winter. With walking and bike paths and benches, the Canal is a great place to get exercise, and meet other members of the community. In close proximity, you will also find Elgin Street, the National Arts Centre, and the Rideau Centre. You can walk home from the Jazz Festival, Winterlude, or Canada Day festivities. This neighbourhood offers great restaurants and pubs, several parks, and a community centre complete with a pool and tennis courts.
host_about: I love to travel and to host guests from around the world.

neighborhood_overview:
These apartments are in the heart of the trendy Vanier district, with easy access to all major downtown attractions as well as Ottawa's finest restaurants, coffee shops, museums, and art galleries.

Nearby attractions include Parliament Hill, Rideau Center, Byward Market, Rideau Canal, Little Italy, China Town, all of the Museums (Canadian War Museum, National Gallery, Canadian Museum of Nature, Canadian Museum of Science and Technology, Canadian Museum of History, and the Canadian Museum of Space and Aviation), Commissioner's Park, Dows Lake Pavillion, several hiking trails, the waterway (popular for kayaking), and Gatineau.

There's also Nordique spa, which is a 20-minute drive in Chelsea, Quebec. It is absolutely beautiful with thermal baths and spas. I'd highly recommend it if you're able to go!

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled between Old Ottawa South and Alta Vista, Heron Park is often named Billings Bridge as it is close to Bank Street and the bridge that crosses the Rideau River into Old Ottawa South.

Walk everywhere! There is a corner store 2 blocks away. Within minutes you will find a Second Cup, Pelican Seafood and Grill, Colonnade Pizza, Icheban Bakery, Sweet Basil Thai, Hometown Sports Grill, Ten Sushi, and O' Brien's pub. This is just to name a few of the pubs and restaurants! Nearby amenities also include Farm Boy, Shoppers Drug Mart, Canadian Tire, Banks, Gas Stations, foreign money exchange and multiple other shops.

Billings Bridge Shopping mall is less than a 10 minute walk - Loblaws, Walmart, pharmacies, clothing stores, food court, natural food pantry, RBC, CIBC, TD, and pretty much anything you need.

A couple of blocks from the Airbnb listing there is a large playground, kids wading pool, ice rink, community gardens, and the Sawmill-Creek nature
host_about: I've been staying in AirBNB properties periodically for 5 years and have enjoyed some great experiences.  Recently I've decided to host my newly renovated basement apartment.  A lot of thought went into the construction materials, interior design and new furnishings and I'm pleased with the outcome. As a host, I will give my guests privacy; however, I am always available for questions. If there is anything I've missed, I will take care of it straight away!

These apartments are in the heart of the trendy Sandy Hill district, and a short walking distance to all major downtown attractions as well as Ottawa's finest restaurants, coffee shops, museums, and art galleries.

Nearby attractions include Parliament Hill, Rideau Center, Rideau Canal, Little Italy, China Town, all of the Museums (Canadian War Museum, National Gallery, Canadian Museum of Nature, Canadian Museum of Science and Technology, Canadian Museum of History, and the Canadian Museum of Space and Aviation), Commissioner's Park, Dows Lake Pavillion, several hiking trails, the waterway (popular for kayaking), and Gatineau.

name: Home in Ottawa · ★4.92 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 shared bath
host_about:
Hi, I'm Remy!

I am a full-time legal/tech analyst who enjoys living in a city with a blossoming music scene. I have been lucky enough to travel to some amazing places and blessed for having opportunity to meet with some wonderful people. 

As this quote says: "A place is only as good as the people you know in it. It's the people that make the place." by  Pittacus Lore. The people in a place bring it to life, and their personalities, values, and actions shape the culture and atmosphere of that location.

Now I slowed down my travels,  and instead developed a passion for being a host. I find great joy in meeting individuals from diverse backgrounds and exchanging stories with them.

I am open and accepting towards all individuals, regardless of where they are in their personal journey. Please don't hesitate to reach out to me if you have any inquiries or concerns regarding my listing.

----
As experienced hosts and travelers, we recognize that guests have varying preferences when it comes to attention and interaction. Some may desire a lot of engagement while others prefer to simply receive the key and have privacy. We put in a lot of effort to ensure that your stay is hassle-free and considerate of your preferences.

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.39 · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 1 bath
Home in Ottawa · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2 baths
neighborhood_overview:
New Edinburgh is a historic and beautiful Ottawa Neighbourhood, nestled between the Rideau and Ottawa Rivers and surrounded by expansive parks and walking and bike pathways.

Home to the residences of both the Prime Minister and the Governor General, New Edinburgh is also home to many embassies and Canada’s Department of Foreign Affairs (DFAIT/GAC).

Located immediately east of Lowertown and the Byward Market, all neighbourhoods in Ottawa’s downtown core are just a short walk, bike, drive or bus trip from New Edinburgh.

New Edinburgh is found on unceded Algonquin Anishinaabe territory.

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★3.67 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
These apartments are steps away from the trendy Little Italy district, and a short walking distance to all major downtown attractions as well as Ottawa's finest restaurants, coffee shops, museums, and art galleries.

Nearby attractions include Parliament Hill, Rideau Center, Byward Market, Rideau Canal, Little Italy, China Town, all of the Museums (Canadian War Museum, National Gallery, Canadian Museum of Nature, Canadian Museum of Science and Technology, Canadian Museum of History, and the Canadian Museum of Space and Aviation), Commissioner's Park, Dows Lake Pavillion, several hiking trails, the waterway (popular for kayaking), and Gatineau.

There's also Nordique spa, which is a 20-minute drive in Chelsea, Quebec. It is absolutely beautiful with thermal baths and spas. I'd highly recommend it if you're able to go!
host_about:
We are thrilled to welcome guests from around the world to share our home and our love of the surrounding area.  We understand how important a successful vacation is; the feelings you get like you're ready to take on the world again. You get to relax with family and friends and take a break from your usual routines, while promoting togetherness and creating shared memories of times spent together. 

We have a passion for creating an inviting space and comfortable atmosphere. We look forward to sharing it with you!

name: Home in Ottawa · 2 bedrooms · 3 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Carson Grove - Carson Meadows is a residential neighbourhood located in the east end of Ottawa, Canada. It is a relatively quiet and peaceful community, consisting mainly of single-family homes and townhouses.

The neighbourhood is bordered by St. Laurent Boulevard to the west, the Aviation Parkway to the east, Ogilvie Road to the north, and the Queensway to the south. It is situated in close proximity to several amenities, including shopping centers, restaurants, parks, and schools.

Carson Grove - Carson Meadows is also well-connected to public transportation, with several bus routes running through the area, providing easy access to other parts of the city. It is a diverse neighbourhood with a mix of residents from different cultural backgrounds. Overall, Carson Grove - Carson Meadows is a family-friendly neighbourhood that offers a comfortable and convenient lifestyle.

name: Home in Ottawa · ★4.97 · 4 bedrooms · 4 beds · 2.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to the Barrhaven neighborhood located southwest of Ottawa downtown core!


Barrhaven is a family-friendly community with a mix of residential and commercial areas. The neighborhood is characterized by numerous playgrounds, schools and parks making it a popular choice for families with children.

Barrhaven is also a great location for foodies and shoppers, with a variety of restaurants, cafes, and grocery stores within a short drive away. You'll find everything from fast food to fine dining.

For those who enjoy sports and recreation, there are several facilities nearby, including Minto Recreation Centre, which offers swimming pools, fitness classes, and ice rinks. There is also a golf course, a tennis court, and a soccer field in the area.

Whether you're visiting Ottawa for business or pleasure, the Barrhaven neighborhood is a great choice for its convenience, accessibility, and its wide range of amenities and attractions

name: Guest suite in Ottawa · ★4.37 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Our apartment is located in Vanier, a vibrant and diverse neighborhood in Ottawa that's just a 10-minute drive from downtown. Vanier is known for its unique mix of residential and commercial areas, offering a wide range of shops, restaurants, and cafes, as well as several parks and recreational areas.

The neighborhood is a melting pot of cultures, with a diverse community that includes residents from all over the world. This diversity is reflected in the variety of cuisines available, with many authentic international restaurants and cafes.

Vanier is also known for its strong sense of community, with several local events and festivals throughout the year that bring residents together. The Vanier Sugar Festival, held in the spring, is a popular event that celebrates the neighborhood's Francophone heritage and maple syrup production.

Nestled in the heart of Sandy Hill, one of Ottawa's most desirable neighbourhoods conveniently located near Ottawa U Campus

As a prime location for both students and young professionals alike, there is no shortlist of things to do year-round in this beautiful heritage neighbourhood.

Steps away from the University of Ottawa, LRT station, Rideau shopping center and other surrounding grocery stores and shops. When you live in the heart of Sandy Hill, running errands won’t take all day and your commute will be short.

Within walking distance, the Byward Market is only a quick 15 minutes away. There you will find a variety of shops, gyms, cafés, and restaurants covering a wide range of delicious cuisines that are sure to satisfy all your cravings.

The best sights in Ottawa are also close by, including Parliament Hill, the iconic Rideau Canal, and the National Art Gallery.

neighborhood_overview:
Overview

The home is on a quiet street in Kanata, a vibrant and picturesque suburb of Ottawa.

Kanata is blessed with abundant natural beauty, making it a paradise for outdoor enthusiasts. Start your journey with a visit to the Walter Baker Sports Centre and enjoy various recreational activities, including ice skating, swimming, and indoor sports. If you prefer the great outdoors, stroll along the scenic Kanata Lakes, perfect for picnics, leisurely walks, and birdwatching. Two parks are a block away in each direction, including a splash pad.

For a more immersive experience, venture into the Carp Hills, a hiker's dream with its rolling terrain and breathtaking views of the Carp Valley. If you're visiting during the warmer months, explore the Carp River Conservation Area, where you can kayak or canoe along the peaceful river, surrounded by lush greenery.

name: Home in Ottawa · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The Overbrook community recently celebrated its 100th anniversary. Near the Francophone neighborhoods of eastern Ottawa, you'll hear both French and English spoken on the street, as well as many other languages from around the world.

One of the oldest Ottawa neighborhoods, many of the unique homes have been here for generations, dating back to the early 1900s. The nearby Vanier Parkway was once the route that carried the first train into the city in the mid 1850s.

Our home was built in the 1940's in the post WWII housing boom, along with many of the homes on our street. All of the houses each have their own special character.

Our shady neighborhood has a small children's park across the street, and a little free library further up towards the Vanier Parkway. The Rideau river is just a hop, skip and a jump away.

There are three municipal wading pools within walking distance for the little ones to splash about (Overbrook Community Centre, St
