name: Rental unit in Ottawa · 1 bedroom · 3 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: The Golden Triangle is Ottawa's most central district known for lively pubs, gourmet & funky restaurants, and cafes along its main strip, Elgin Street. Close to Parliament Hill and the Ottawa River, the area is home to several embassies and the Ottawa City Hall complex, with a plaza and pop-up ice-skating rink out front. Leafy Minto Park offers benches and picnic tables, while a paved cycling and walking path line the Rideau Canal - which is the world's longest skating rink in winter - bordering the neighbourhood. This apartment is on a quiet street in the centre of the Golden Triangle.
host_about: I travel for extended periods internationally for work with Ottawa being my base. I have a mix of geeky hobbies and do a variety of sports so you will have a mix of games, books,  and workout equipment. host_about:
My name is Jasmin! 

I consider myself a nature lover who enjoys hiking, biking, travelling, and the simple things life has to offer. Living with respect and care for all sentient beings is my philosophy of life. 

My formal education is in Business/Finance, Tourism, and Events. I have extensive experience in sustainable tourism and particularly in hospitality. As a proud Canadian I wish travellers get to experience and learn the natural attractions my country has to offer and that they make a genuine connection with our diverse culture. 

As a host, I will always give my best to make your guest experience as memorable and great as possible. Feel free to reach me anytime regarding your stay or any advice on tours or activities in the Toronto or Ottawa area, or throughout the country.

You will be adjacent to the vibrant Byward Market area with its pedestrian courtyards, many restaurants and bars, specialty food shops, street-side vendors, buskers, retail stores and boutiques.

Use dedicated walking/cycling paths to go from the condo, along the historic Rideau Canal, past Dow’s Lake, Carleton University, and to the beach at Mooney’s Bay.

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.89 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to Hintonburg, a vibrant neighbourhood in Ottawa. With its rich history, artistic flair, and diverse community, Hintonburg offers a unique and charming experience.

Located just west of downtown Ottawa, Hintonburg is known for its local shops, trendy cafes, and delicious restaurants. Explore the streets lined with heritage buildings and contemporary architecture, creating a visually captivating atmosphere.

Hintonburg is a haven for art enthusiasts, with numerous galleries and creative spaces showcasing local talent. Indulge in the diverse culinary scene, from cozy cafes to farm-to-table eateries. Browse boutique shops offering vintage clothing, handmade crafts, and unique finds.

Nature lovers will appreciate the neighbourhood's proximity to green spaces and parks. Stroll along the Ottawa River or enjoy a picnic in Hintonburg Park. And with easy access to public transportation, you can explore Ottawa's downtown core, Parliament Hill, and museums.<

name: Home in Ottawa · ★4.90 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1.5 baths
neighborhood_overview:
We live downtown on a quiet street at the intersection of four of Ottawa's most interesting neighbourhoods - Centretown, Little Italy, Chinatown, and Hintonburg.

There's a beautiful park on our street, and we're just a short walk away from the Ottawa River Pathway, Dow's Lake, the Dominion Arboretum, and the Rideau Canal--and so much more!

Within walking distance, you can explore spots that the locals swear by and get a sense of what Ottawa's really about. You'll find a selection of cafes, restaurants, craft breweries, food trucks, patios, art galleries, and shops that suit just about anyone's taste. These are just some of the reasons we love to live downtown.
host_about:
I enjoy nothing more than kicking back with a nice warm cup of good coffee and listening to records. That is what I call self-care. 

I am a writer, and used to be a music blogger. I grew up in London, Ontario, and completed my BA and MA there as well. 

I moved to Ottawa in 2008 and fell in love with the city.

name: Home in Ottawa · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Westboro is a quiet and friendly neighborhood in Ottawa, walking distance to Richmond road, where there are plenty of trendy restaurants, cafes and little stores, including a large grocery store.

It takes just under 30 mins on public transit to get to Parliament Hill. There are parks nearby, farmers markets, Westboro and Britannia beaches, and a trail by the river.
host_about:
I love travelling and wandering around a new place, getting a feel for the local culture. Airbnb really enables us to get immersed and explore local neighbourhoods, which I love.
My partner and I have had the chance to use Airbnb several times in different countries by now and we've had such great experiences. It's become our favourite way to travel.
I also speak French and Spanish and my partner also speaks Dutch.
Cheers to new adventures! 
Valérie

Home in Ottawa · ★5.0 · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled on a tranquil street, our unit offers a peaceful retreat just a five-minute walk from the vibrant main street of Little Italy. Explore an array of fantastic restaurants and charming cafes at your doorstep. Nature enthusiasts will delight in the proximity to Dow's Lake, where you can embark on leisurely walks or bike rides along the scenic Rideau Canal trails, allowing you to discover the city's beauty firsthand.

Being centrally located, our unit serves as the perfect hub for exploring Ottawa's trendiest neighborhoods, including the Glebe, Hintonburg, China Town, and Centre town. Immerse yourself in their unique vibes and discover their hidden gems.

For those planning a longer stay, the unit's central location offers unrivaled convenience. Enjoy easy access to amenities, public transportation, and key landmarks, such as the airport (15 mins), the Civic Hospital (5 mins), Carleton University (5 mins), Ottawa University (15 mins), and the vibrant Byward Marke

neighborhood_overview: Little Italy is the mecca for authentic Italian food in Ottawa. But Greek, Indian and Asian flavours, plus other unique culinary specialties, have made this quaint area a fully rounded foodie destination. Try Bridgehead Roastery’s coffee, Gelatini’s authentic gelato, and Atelier’s molecular gastronomy. Choose a brew (or a few) from the famous “beer bible” at Pub Italia – a funky pub co-owned by an Italo-Irish couple, or swing by Two Six {Ate} for delicious small plates and drinks. Delizioso!

name: Guest suite in Ottawa · ★5.0 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Situated within the Ottawa - Gatineau metropolitan area, Hawthorne Meadows is a small residential and commercial neighbourhood southeast of Ottawa’s downtown core.

Located in the Alta Vista ward, Hawthorne Meadows is a mature suburb that has become sought-after real estate thanks to its proximity to amenities, industry, parks and natural spaces, and family-friendly recreation.

Shopping Centres: Giant Tiger (corner of Melfort and Walkey), St. Laurent Shopping Centre (north on St. Laurent Blvd), and Train Yards (north on St. Laurent and west on Industrial Drive or Belfast Road). There are lots of amenities and restaurants along all the adjoining roads.
host_about:
Hey, Jesse here!

I am a professional working for the federal government. I enjoy dining out, staying active and exploring new places. I grew up in the national capital region and I used to host on Airbnb a few years ago. I am excited to start again and connect with people whether as a host or a traveler. 

While renting my renovated and private 1 bedroom lower level apartment, I will do my best to make your stay as comfortable as possible.

name: Home in Ottawa · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Leafy, upscale New Edinburgh is home to the residences of the Prime Minister and the Governor General.

The area is also known for Rideau Falls Park, featuring dramatic cascades at the confluence of the Ottawa and Rideau rivers. Grab a bite to eat or treat yourself to a drink at Tavern on the Falls (1 John Street).

Want to cool off? Check out a newly restored historic landmark: NCC River House (501 Sir-George-Étienne-Cartier Pkwy), with free entry and swimming hours of 7 AM - 7 PM (July 26th to September 4, 2023). The NCC River House also includes a bistro, two wraparound balconies with stunning views of the Ottawa River. Please note the Bistro’s operating hours : 11 AM to 9 PM (May 1st - October 31), 10 AM to 2 PM (November 1st - April 30th).

Stanley Park has riverside trails and hosts the Lumière Festival with lanterns and light installations each August.

A hidden gem nestled in the residential area of New Edinburgh and adored by local re
host_about: Music enthusiast. Adventure seeker. Gardener. Foodie. Cook.

neighborhood_overview:
You’ll find multiple spots to shop in Barrhaven including Barrhaven Town Centre, Chapman Mills Marketplace, Strandherd Crossing and Barrhaven Mall. Shops include spots like Winners, Carter’s OshKosh, Plato’s closet and more! Plenty of grocery stores including Costco or more boutique shops for all your groceries.

Many pubs and restaurants in the area. Pubs and restaurants include Heart & Crown, Barley Mow, Greenfields, Broadways, Royal Oak, The Jolly Taxpayer Bar & Grill, Brown’s Socialhouse, Montana’s, Lonestar, and Eastside Mario’s to name a few.

Barrhaven has lots of parks and trails to explore. At the different parks you’ll find splash pads, soccer fields, forest trails, bike trails, wide open spaces perfect for a picnic and more.

Welcome to the charming neighborhood of Castle Heights in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada – a hidden gem that offers the perfect blend of urban convenience and serene surroundings. Nestled just east of the downtown core, Castle Heights provides a unique experience for visitors seeking a tranquil retreat within reach of all the city's attractions.

About the Neighbourhood:

Castle Heights is known for its tree-lined streets, well-maintained parks, and a friendly community atmosphere. This residential area boasts a mix of architectural styles, including classic brick homes, cozy cottages, and modern townhouses, creating a diverse streetscape that's a joy to explore. Its peaceful ambiance makes it a favourite among families, couples, and solo travellers looking to experience Ottawa like a local.

neighborhood_overview:
You’ll find plenty of things to do in Bayshore-Belltown. At the eastern border of Belltown is Britannia Park. This Ottawa River recreation area filled with beaches and boating dates back to 1900. It was such a popular summer destination that it sparked the building of Belltown’s cottages in the 1920s.

PARKS AND SHOPPING

Outdoor enthusiasts can visit Andrew Hayden Park along the western edge of Belltown. You’ll find picnickers, a bandshell, and plenty of walking trails for birdwatching. Check for events at the community centre or play some tennis while you’re there.

Do you need to do some shopping? Stop by the busy Bayshore Shopping Centre. Constructed in 1973 with two floors and 123,000 square feet, the mall has since grown to three floors with 883,250 square feet of retail stores.

This wonderfully diverse neighborhood also offers a nice selection of specialty grocery stores in the very walkable Carling Avenue area.

neighborhood_overview:
Located on the border between the LeBreton Flats neighbourhood and Centertown West (which encompasses Chinatown and Little Italy).

Le Breton Flats:
Le Breton Flats is an area beside the Ottawa River, known for its sprawling green spaces and for being home to the glass-roofed Canadian War Museum. The annual BluesFest in July, and other music and food festivals, are held in LeBreton Flats Park close by. As well, LeBreton is also connected to the main system of bike pathways which run through the city-- with the Ottawa River as its northern border, you can enjoy biking, walking and skating along the waterfront. With its emphasis on “green living”, LeBreton Flats is pedestrian and bicycle-friendly; 40% of the community is set aside for parks, courtyards, walkways and open space. LeBreton Flats is located within walking distance of downtown, but is far enough removed from downtown that the hustle and bustle of the main roads have not spilled over into the community. The Fla

neighborhood_overview:
Orleans is a neighborhood located in the eastern part of Ottawa, Canada's capital city. While it may not be as well-known as some other neighborhoods in Ottawa, there are still plenty of things to see and do in Orleans. Here are some recommendations:

Petrie Island: This beautiful natural area is known for its sandy beaches, walking trails, and birdwatching opportunities. It's a great place to relax, swim, or take a leisurely stroll.

Shenkman Arts Centre: This cultural hub hosts various events, including theater performances, art exhibitions, and concerts. Check their schedule to see if there's anything of interest during your visit.

Farming Fun: Orleans is home to several farms where you can pick your own fruits and vegetables. Depending on the season, you can visit places like Orleans Fruit Farm or Shouldice Berry Farm for a fun and interactive experience.

Outdoor Activities: Orleans offers numerous parks and green spaces where you can enjoy
host_about:
I gave up my finance career in 2010 to pursue a lifelong dream: to travel the world full time. To support myself, I rent out my apartment on Airbnb. It's been a great experience!

I share my adventures with the world and to my guests! I love exploring the planet, learning different cultures and discovering new places.

Im also a big fan of anything that involves the ocean and starts with an "s", such as scuba diving, swimming, surfing, sailing, and snorkelling. 

I love meeting people from different parts of the world and I look forward to connecting with you as a host or traveller. I will do my best to make your stay as comfortable as possible or bring a good guest, depending on my role.

neighborhood_overview:

Pamela and Judith live on site, ready to welcome you to their home.
host_about:
We are Judith & Pamela!  We met years ago as neighbours working on volunteer projects around education and also environmental issues in our community.  We became good friends along the way.  

With our nests emptying, we decided to open a Bed and Breakfast, together.  Having worked with international clientele throughout our careers, hosting guests from out of town fits with our interests and lifestyle.  We have lots of plans to make our home and guest spaces a showcase for sustainable living. We are hoping our guests give us suggestions while they are with us!

Judith currently works as a supply teacher in the OCDSBoard. She also runs a house painting business, and a myriad of other smaller jobs. Pamela taught international teachers how to teach English as a second or foreign language;  now she works from home, teaching online and welcoming guests.  

The two of us will live in the apartment on the main level. You'll see us  in and out of the apartment during the day.

neighborhood_overview:
Nestled in the heart of Canada's capital, 185 Lyon Street stands proudly in downtown Ottawa, a hub of culture, history, and urban vibrancy. A stone's throw away from Parliament Hill, this location offers a front-row seat to the nation's most iconic landmarks and the captivating ceremonies of the Changing of the Guard.

Wander through the neighborhood, and you'll find a rich tapestry of museums, including the National Gallery of Canada and the Canadian Museum of History, each showcasing the diverse and storied heritage of the nation. The nearby Rideau Canal, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, beckons visitors year-round, whether for a leisurely summer boat ride or ice-skating in the winter.

This building is situated in the vibrant and dynamic neighbourhood of Centre West Ottawa which encompasses Chinatown and Little Italy, offering an unbeatable location for urban living. With easy access to shops, restaurants, and entertainment options, you'll have everything you need right at your doorstep.

Many of the recreational activities in Little Italy are centered around the Italian culture. There are many bars and restaurants scattered throughout the community that serve up delicious Italian cuisine. The community has several parks that have sports fields, an outdoor rink, a baseball diamond, a splash pad, and a pool. Dow's Lake touches the southern border of the community and has paddle boating and canoeing available to residents and there are biking and walking paths that wind around the lake and continue into the city.

name: Home in Ottawa · 2 bedrooms · 2 beds · 2.5 baths
Home in Ottawa · ★New · 3 bedrooms · 3 beds · 3 baths
neighborhood_overview:
Location, location, location! Our home is in the heart of the Glebe, two blocks from TD Lansdowne, with the best amenities (shops, bakeries, restaurants, bars, breweries, yoga studios, fitness studios, spas, parks) and a ton of both summer and winter activities around.

TD Lansdowne is two blocks from us, where the 67s and Redblacks play and where concerts and comedians do shows. At Lansdowne there is an outdoor skating rink, inner rollerskating ring, outdoor skate park, basketball court, summer / fall farmers market, crafters market, dog park, a movie theatre, a fitness centre (Goodlife), Winners, Sporting Life, Whole Foods, and multiple bars & restaurants.

We are also just five minutes away from the World's largest ice rink / where you can also do water sports all summer), and a plethora of parks, biking and walking trails, and more and we have a ton of 24 hour food options nearby.

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Lower Town is a hub for artists and start-ups, with 19th-century buildings on Dalhousie Street reborn as craft coffee roasters and brewpubs. The Royal Canadian Mint displays a million-dollar coin while the National Gallery of Canada shows international and Canadian art, with sweeping city views from its stylish cafeteria. The vibrant streets near the ByWard Market area have quirky clothes shops and hip music venues.

Lower Town is the oldest neighbourhood in Ottawa. Rideau Street acts as the southern border, the Ottawa River is to the north, and the Rideau River is to the west. In the early days, it was home to French Canadians and Irish settlers. Today, it’s an artist hub, as well as one of Ottawa’s top tourist attractions, the ByWard Market. The Notre Dame Cathedral Basilica is gorgeous, and there are a lot of murals and sculptures to see throughout the neighbourhood. It’s also home to several embassies.

Nestled in the southwest corner of Ottawa, Barrhaven is a thriving neighborhood that offers a unique blend of urban convenience and natural beauty. Here’s what makes Barrhaven an ideal place to enhance your visit to Ottawa!

1. Proximity to Transportation Hubs: Barrhaven’s strategic location is a key highlight. It’s just a 15-minute drive to the Ottawa Macdonald-Cartier International Airport, making travel a breeze for both frequent flyers and vacation enthusiasts. Additionally, the Via Rail station is only 5 minutes away, connecting residents to convenient rail travel options.

2. Easy Access to Major Highways: Barrhaven’s accessibility is further enhanced by its proximity to the main highways. Just 2 kilometers away from the Queen Elizabeth Highway and other major roadways, residents enjoy effortless commuting to various parts of Ottawa and beyond.

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★3.67 · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
The first Chinese to settle in Ottawa arrived around 1911, and by 1931 they established Chinatown on Albert Street, between Kent and O’Conner. As the city grew and office buildings began to pop up downtown, Chinatown businesses began to close. In the 1970s an influx of Chinese and Vietnamese immigrants arrived, and a new Chinatown started to emerge on Somerset Street W, between Bay and Preston. The Royal Arch (a joint project with Beijing), the gateway to Chinatown, was erected on Somerset, just after Bronson Ave, in 2010.

In June, Ottawa Chinatown Night Market is an event not to be missed. It’s three days of live music, dragon and lion dance, and truly amazing eats.

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★New · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Overbook is a rapidly developing neighbourhood located in the east end of Ottawa. It is located across the Rideau River, from the neighbourhoods of Lower Town and Sandy Hill, just to the south of Vanier, Rockcliffe Park, and New Edinburgh. To the east, you can find the suburb of Gloucester.

Small-scale businesses line Donald Street on the neighbourhood's northern area. While the neighbourhood is quiet and residential, it is situated conveniently to St. Laurent Shopping Centre with anchors including Sears and The Bay, along with Bath and Body Works, Guess, SportChek, and many others. Nearby, you can also find The Ottawa Trainyards featuring WalMart and Marshall's. Even more shopping is available on both Montreal Road and Beechwood Avenue.

If you're looking for great Italian food, there is no shortage here in Overbrook. Louis' Restaurant and Pizzeria and Pizzaro's are two excellent, family-friendly restaurants centrally located in the neighbourhood.
host_about:
I love to travel and really enjoy meeting new people and learning about different cultures. I am morally aligned with the AIRBNB vision of helping you discover amazing places while you travel within the comforts of home.

I have been an Airbnb host now for over five years. I love interacting with my guests and ensuring they're happy in their space. 

I'm non-smoking, responsible, clean and very respectful of other peoples property.

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★New · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.33 · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
This lovely condo unit is situated in the heart of Lower Town, a charming and historic neighborhood located just east of Downtown Ottawa. Located within walking distance of some of Ottawa's top attractions, including the National Gallery of Canada and Parliament Hill, this condo unit is the perfect home base for exploring the city's rich cultural heritage and vibrant downtown scene.

Lowertown is a hub for artists and start-ups, with 19th-century buildings on Dalhousie Street reborn as craft coffee roasters and brewpubs. The Royal Canadian Mint displays a million-dollar coin while the National Gallery of Canada shows international and Canadian art, with sweeping city views from its stylish cafeteria. The vibrant streets near the ByWard Market area have quirky clothes shops and hip music venues.
host_about:
We are thrilled to welcome guests from around the world to share our home and our love of the surrounding area. We understand how important a successful vacation is; the feelings you get like you're ready to take on the world again. You get to relax with family and friends and take a break from your usual routines, while promoting togetherness and creating shared memories of times spent together. 

We have a passion for creating an inviting space and comfortable atmosphere. We look forward to sharing it with you!

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★4.67 · Studio · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview: Downtown is the elegant riverside core of old Ottawa, with Gothic-style government buildings on Parliament Hill, sweeping views from the Peace Tower and cruise boats navigating the Rideau Canal. The National Arts Centre hosts ballets, symphonies and Broadway shows, while the stone-built Bytown Museum has exhibits on native Algonquin tribes and early European settlers. Pubs, cafes and gift shops line Elgin Street.

name: Rental unit in Ottawa · ★New · 1 bedroom · 1 bed · 1 bath
neighborhood_overview:
Preston Street, as we call Little Italy, is a lively and eclectic district located just west of downtown Ottawa. Known for its charming atmosphere, the street is lined with a mix of residential buildings, businesses, and an array of restaurants, cafes, and shops. The neighbourhood has a great local feel, with outdoor patios, colourful storefronts, and a welcoming community spirit.

The heart of Ottawa's Little Italy, Preston Street is celebrated for its diverse culinary scene. Italian restaurants, cafes, and bakeries serve up delicious pasta, pizza, gelato, and other authentic Italian treats. The street comes alive during special events and festivals, where the community gathers to celebrate its cultural heritage.

Yearly festivals nearby include Winterlude and the Tulip Festival in the spring.
host_about:

name: Home in Ottawa · ★New · 1 bedroom · 2 beds · 1 private bath
host_about: Im a psychotherapist and clinical social worker.   Im also a musician and artist with passionate interests in film, design, books, nature and people. I live in a urban center but restore at a off the grid wild forest and lake cabin that Ive been working on since 1993. I love to travel off the beaten path with my partner Bob-a historian and foodie who adores baking bread, listening to jazz, reading and gardening,  sometimes at the same time. Airbnb has been good to me around the world. As a home owner in Ottawa , I think we make great guests, as we know the hard work that goes into making a home. Id like to think we are 'super guests'.
